20971 void QCPGraph::setScatterSkip(int skip)
20972 {
20973  mScatterSkip = qMax(0, skip);
20974 }
20975 
20985 void QCPGraph::setChannelFillGraph(QCPGraph *targetGraph)
20986 {
20987  // prevent setting channel target to this graph itself:
20988  if (targetGraph == this)
20989  {
20990  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "targetGraph is this graph itself";
20991  mChannelFillGraph = nullptr;
20992  return;
20993  }
20994  // prevent setting channel target to a graph not in the plot:
20995  if (targetGraph && targetGraph->mParentPlot != mParentPlot)
20996  {
20997  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "targetGraph not in same plot";
20998  mChannelFillGraph = nullptr;
20999  return;
21000  }
21001 
21002  mChannelFillGraph = targetGraph;
21003 }
21004 
21036 void QCPGraph::setAdaptiveSampling(bool enabled)
21037 {
21038  mAdaptiveSampling = enabled;
21039 }
21040 
21053 void QCPGraph::addData(const QVector<double> &keys, const QVector<double> &values, bool alreadySorted)
21054 {
21055  if (keys.size() != values.size())
21056  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "keys and values have different sizes:" << keys.size() << values.size();
21057  const int n = qMin(keys.size(), values.size());
21058  QVector<QCPGraphData> tempData(n);
21059  QVector<QCPGraphData>::iterator it = tempData.begin();
21060  const QVector<QCPGraphData>::iterator itEnd = tempData.end();
21061  int i = 0;
21062  while (it != itEnd)
21063  {
21064  it->key = keys[i];
21065  it->value = values[i];
21066  ++it;
21067  ++i;
21068  }
21069  mDataContainer->add(tempData, alreadySorted); // don't modify tempData beyond this to prevent copy on write
21070 }
21071 
21079 void QCPGraph::addData(double key, double value)
21080 {
21081  mDataContainer->add(QCPGraphData(key, value));
21082 }
21083 
21092 double QCPGraph::selectTest(const QPointF &pos, bool onlySelectable, QVariant *details) const
21093 {
21094  if ((onlySelectable && mSelectable == QCP::stNone) || mDataContainer->isEmpty())
21095  return -1;
21096  if (!mKeyAxis || !mValueAxis)
21097  return -1;
21098 
21099  if (mKeyAxis.data()->axisRect()->rect().contains(pos.toPoint()) || mParentPlot->interactions().testFlag(QCP::iSelectPlottablesBeyondAxisRect))
21100  {
21101  QCPGraphDataContainer::const_iterator closestDataPoint = mDataContainer->constEnd();
21102  double result = pointDistance(pos, closestDataPoint);
21103  if (details)
21104  {
21105  int pointIndex = int(closestDataPoint-mDataContainer->constBegin());
21106  details->setValue(QCPDataSelection(QCPDataRange(pointIndex, pointIndex+1)));
21107  }
21108  return result;
21109  } else
21110  return -1;
21111 }
21112 
21113 /* inherits documentation from base class */
21114 QCPRange QCPGraph::getKeyRange(bool &foundRange, QCP::SignDomain inSignDomain) const
21115 {
21116  return mDataContainer->keyRange(foundRange, inSignDomain);
21117 }
21118 
21119 /* inherits documentation from base class */
21120 QCPRange QCPGraph::getValueRange(bool &foundRange, QCP::SignDomain inSignDomain, const QCPRange &inKeyRange) const
21121 {
21122  return mDataContainer->valueRange(foundRange, inSignDomain, inKeyRange);
21123 }
21124 
21125 /* inherits documentation from base class */
21126 void QCPGraph::draw(QCPPainter *painter)
21127 {
21128  if (!mKeyAxis || !mValueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return; }
21129  if (mKeyAxis.data()->range().size() <= 0 || mDataContainer->isEmpty()) return;
21130  if (mLineStyle == lsNone && mScatterStyle.isNone()) return;
21131 
21132  QVector<QPointF> lines, scatters; // line and (if necessary) scatter pixel coordinates will be stored here while iterating over segments
21133 
21134  // loop over and draw segments of unselected/selected data:
21135  QList<QCPDataRange> selectedSegments, unselectedSegments, allSegments;
21136  getDataSegments(selectedSegments, unselectedSegments);
21137  allSegments << unselectedSegments << selectedSegments;
21138  for (int i=0; i<allSegments.size(); ++i)
21139  {
21140  bool isSelectedSegment = i >= unselectedSegments.size();
21141  // get line pixel points appropriate to line style:
21142  QCPDataRange lineDataRange = isSelectedSegment ? allSegments.at(i) : allSegments.at(i).adjusted(-1, 1); // unselected segments extend lines to bordering selected data point (safe to exceed total data bounds in first/last segment, getLines takes care)
21143  getLines(&lines, lineDataRange);
21144 
21145  // check data validity if flag set:
21146 #ifdef QCUSTOMPLOT_CHECK_DATA
21147  QCPGraphDataContainer::const_iterator it;
21148  for (it = mDataContainer->constBegin(); it != mDataContainer->constEnd(); ++it)
21149  {
21150  if (QCP::isInvalidData(it->key, it->value))
21151  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "Data point at" << it->key << "invalid." << "Plottable name:" << name();
21152  }
21153 #endif
21154 
21155  // draw fill of graph:
21156  if (isSelectedSegment && mSelectionDecorator)
21157  mSelectionDecorator->applyBrush(painter);
21158  else
21159  painter->setBrush(mBrush);
21160  painter->setPen(Qt::NoPen);
21161  drawFill(painter, &lines);
21162 
21163  // draw line:
21164  if (mLineStyle != lsNone)
21165  {
21166  if (isSelectedSegment && mSelectionDecorator)
21167  mSelectionDecorator->applyPen(painter);
21168  else
21169  painter->setPen(mPen);
21170  painter->setBrush(Qt::NoBrush);
21171  if (mLineStyle == lsImpulse)
21172  drawImpulsePlot(painter, lines);
21173  else
21174  drawLinePlot(painter, lines); // also step plots can be drawn as a line plot
21175  }
21176 
21177  // draw scatters:
21178  QCPScatterStyle finalScatterStyle = mScatterStyle;
21179  if (isSelectedSegment && mSelectionDecorator)
21180  finalScatterStyle = mSelectionDecorator->getFinalScatterStyle(mScatterStyle);
21181  if (!finalScatterStyle.isNone())
21182  {
21183  getScatters(&scatters, allSegments.at(i));
21184  drawScatterPlot(painter, scatters, finalScatterStyle);
21185  }
21186  }
21187 
21188  // draw other selection decoration that isn't just line/scatter pens and brushes:
21189  if (mSelectionDecorator)
21190  mSelectionDecorator->drawDecoration(painter, selection());
21191 }
21192 
21193 /* inherits documentation from base class */
21194 void QCPGraph::drawLegendIcon(QCPPainter *painter, const QRectF &rect) const
21195 {
21196  // draw fill:
21197  if (mBrush.style() != Qt::NoBrush)
21198  {
21199  applyFillAntialiasingHint(painter);
21200  painter->fillRect(QRectF(rect.left(), rect.top()+rect.height()/2.0, rect.width(), rect.height()/3.0), mBrush);
21201  }
21202  // draw line vertically centered:
21203  if (mLineStyle != lsNone)
21204  {
21205  applyDefaultAntialiasingHint(painter);
21206  painter->setPen(mPen);
21207  painter->drawLine(QLineF(rect.left(), rect.top()+rect.height()/2.0, rect.right()+5, rect.top()+rect.height()/2.0)); // +5 on x2 else last segment is missing from dashed/dotted pens
21208  }
21209  // draw scatter symbol:
21210  if (!mScatterStyle.isNone())
21211  {
21212  applyScattersAntialiasingHint(painter);
21213  // scale scatter pixmap if it's too large to fit in legend icon rect:
21214  if (mScatterStyle.shape() == QCPScatterStyle::ssPixmap && (mScatterStyle.pixmap().size().width() > rect.width() || mScatterStyle.pixmap().size().height() > rect.height()))
21215  {
21216  QCPScatterStyle scaledStyle(mScatterStyle);
21217  scaledStyle.setPixmap(scaledStyle.pixmap().scaled(rect.size().toSize(), Qt::KeepAspectRatio, Qt::SmoothTransformation));
21218  scaledStyle.applyTo(painter, mPen);
21219  scaledStyle.drawShape(painter, QRectF(rect).center());
21220  } else
21221  {
21222  mScatterStyle.applyTo(painter, mPen);
21223  mScatterStyle.drawShape(painter, QRectF(rect).center());
21224  }
21225  }
21226 }
21227 
21248 void QCPGraph::getLines(QVector<QPointF> *lines, const QCPDataRange &dataRange) const
21249 {
21250  if (!lines) return;
21251  QCPGraphDataContainer::const_iterator begin, end;
21252  getVisibleDataBounds(begin, end, dataRange);
21253  if (begin == end)
21254  {
21255  lines->clear();
21256  return;
21257  }
21258 
21259  QVector<QCPGraphData> lineData;
21260  if (mLineStyle != lsNone)
21261  getOptimizedLineData(&lineData, begin, end);
21262 
21263  if (mKeyAxis->rangeReversed() != (mKeyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)) // make sure key pixels are sorted ascending in lineData (significantly simplifies following processing)
21264  std::reverse(lineData.begin(), lineData.end());
21265 
21266  switch (mLineStyle)
21267  {
21268  case lsNone: lines->clear(); break;
21269  case lsLine: *lines = dataToLines(lineData); break;
21270  case lsStepLeft: *lines = dataToStepLeftLines(lineData); break;
21271  case lsStepRight: *lines = dataToStepRightLines(lineData); break;
21272  case lsStepCenter: *lines = dataToStepCenterLines(lineData); break;
21273  case lsImpulse: *lines = dataToImpulseLines(lineData); break;
21274  }
21275 }
21276 
21289 void QCPGraph::getScatters(QVector<QPointF> *scatters, const QCPDataRange &dataRange) const
21290 {
21291  if (!scatters) return;
21292  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
21293  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
21294  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; scatters->clear(); return; }
21295 
21296  QCPGraphDataContainer::const_iterator begin, end;
21297  getVisibleDataBounds(begin, end, dataRange);
21298  if (begin == end)
21299  {
21300  scatters->clear();
21301  return;
21302  }
21303 
21304  QVector<QCPGraphData> data;
21305  getOptimizedScatterData(&data, begin, end);
21306 
21307  if (mKeyAxis->rangeReversed() != (mKeyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)) // make sure key pixels are sorted ascending in data (significantly simplifies following processing)
21308  std::reverse(data.begin(), data.end());
21309 
21310  scatters->resize(data.size());
21311  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
21312  {
21313  for (int i=0; i<data.size(); ++i)
21314  {
21315  if (!qIsNaN(data.at(i).value))
21316  {
21317  (*scatters)[i].setX(valueAxis->coordToPixel(data.at(i).value));
21318  (*scatters)[i].setY(keyAxis->coordToPixel(data.at(i).key));
21319  }
21320  }
21321  } else
21322  {
21323  for (int i=0; i<data.size(); ++i)
21324  {
21325  if (!qIsNaN(data.at(i).value))
21326  {
21327  (*scatters)[i].setX(keyAxis->coordToPixel(data.at(i).key));
21328  (*scatters)[i].setY(valueAxis->coordToPixel(data.at(i).value));
21329  }
21330  }
21331  }
21332 }
21333 
21344 QVector<QPointF> QCPGraph::dataToLines(const QVector<QCPGraphData> &data) const
21345 {
21346  QVector<QPointF> result;
21347  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
21348  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
21349  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return result; }
21350 
21351  result.resize(data.size());
21352 
21353  // transform data points to pixels:
21354  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
21355  {
21356  for (int i=0; i<data.size(); ++i)
21357  {
21358  result[i].setX(valueAxis->coordToPixel(data.at(i).value));
21359  result[i].setY(keyAxis->coordToPixel(data.at(i).key));
21360  }
21361  } else // key axis is horizontal
21362  {
21363  for (int i=0; i<data.size(); ++i)
21364  {
21365  result[i].setX(keyAxis->coordToPixel(data.at(i).key));
21366  result[i].setY(valueAxis->coordToPixel(data.at(i).value));
21367  }
21368  }
21369  return result;
21370 }
21371 
21382 QVector<QPointF> QCPGraph::dataToStepLeftLines(const QVector<QCPGraphData> &data) const
21383 {
21384  QVector<QPointF> result;
21385  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
21386  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
21387  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return result; }
21388 
21389  result.resize(data.size()*2);
21390 
21391  // calculate steps from data and transform to pixel coordinates:
21392  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
21393  {
21394  double lastValue = valueAxis->coordToPixel(data.first().value);
21395  for (int i=0; i<data.size(); ++i)
21396  {
21397  const double key = keyAxis->coordToPixel(data.at(i).key);
21398  result[i*2+0].setX(lastValue);
21399  result[i*2+0].setY(key);
21400  lastValue = valueAxis->coordToPixel(data.at(i).value);
21401  result[i*2+1].setX(lastValue);
21402  result[i*2+1].setY(key);
21403  }
21404  } else // key axis is horizontal
21405  {
21406  double lastValue = valueAxis->coordToPixel(data.first().value);
21407  for (int i=0; i<data.size(); ++i)
21408  {
21409  const double key = keyAxis->coordToPixel(data.at(i).key);
21410  result[i*2+0].setX(key);
21411  result[i*2+0].setY(lastValue);
21412  lastValue = valueAxis->coordToPixel(data.at(i).value);
21413  result[i*2+1].setX(key);
21414  result[i*2+1].setY(lastValue);
21415  }
21416  }
21417  return result;
21418 }
21419 
21430 QVector<QPointF> QCPGraph::dataToStepRightLines(const QVector<QCPGraphData> &data) const
21431 {
21432  QVector<QPointF> result;
21433  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
21434  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
21435  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return result; }
21436 
21437  result.resize(data.size()*2);
21438 
21439  // calculate steps from data and transform to pixel coordinates:
21440  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
21441  {
21442  double lastKey = keyAxis->coordToPixel(data.first().key);
21443  for (int i=0; i<data.size(); ++i)
21444  {
21445  const double value = valueAxis->coordToPixel(data.at(i).value);
21446  result[i*2+0].setX(value);
21447  result[i*2+0].setY(lastKey);
21448  lastKey = keyAxis->coordToPixel(data.at(i).key);
21449  result[i*2+1].setX(value);
21450  result[i*2+1].setY(lastKey);
21451  }
21452  } else // key axis is horizontal
21453  {
21454  double lastKey = keyAxis->coordToPixel(data.first().key);
21455  for (int i=0; i<data.size(); ++i)
21456  {
21457  const double value = valueAxis->coordToPixel(data.at(i).value);
21458  result[i*2+0].setX(lastKey);
21459  result[i*2+0].setY(value);
21460  lastKey = keyAxis->coordToPixel(data.at(i).key);
21461  result[i*2+1].setX(lastKey);
21462  result[i*2+1].setY(value);
21463  }
21464  }
21465  return result;
21466 }
21467 
21478 QVector<QPointF> QCPGraph::dataToStepCenterLines(const QVector<QCPGraphData> &data) const
21479 {
21480  QVector<QPointF> result;
21481  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
21482  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
21483  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return result; }
21484 
21485  result.resize(data.size()*2);
21486 
21487  // calculate steps from data and transform to pixel coordinates:
21488  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
21489  {
21490  double lastKey = keyAxis->coordToPixel(data.first().key);
21491  double lastValue = valueAxis->coordToPixel(data.first().value);
21492  result[0].setX(lastValue);
21493  result[0].setY(lastKey);
21494  for (int i=1; i<data.size(); ++i)
21495  {
21496  const double key = (keyAxis->coordToPixel(data.at(i).key)+lastKey)*0.5;
21497  result[i*2-1].setX(lastValue);
21498  result[i*2-1].setY(key);
21499  lastValue = valueAxis->coordToPixel(data.at(i).value);
21500  lastKey = keyAxis->coordToPixel(data.at(i).key);
21501  result[i*2+0].setX(lastValue);
21502  result[i*2+0].setY(key);
21503  }
21504  result[data.size()*2-1].setX(lastValue);
21505  result[data.size()*2-1].setY(lastKey);
21506  } else // key axis is horizontal
21507  {
21508  double lastKey = keyAxis->coordToPixel(data.first().key);
21509  double lastValue = valueAxis->coordToPixel(data.first().value);
21510  result[0].setX(lastKey);
21511  result[0].setY(lastValue);
21512  for (int i=1; i<data.size(); ++i)
21513  {
21514  const double key = (keyAxis->coordToPixel(data.at(i).key)+lastKey)*0.5;
21515  result[i*2-1].setX(key);
21516  result[i*2-1].setY(lastValue);
21517  lastValue = valueAxis->coordToPixel(data.at(i).value);
21518  lastKey = keyAxis->coordToPixel(data.at(i).key);
21519  result[i*2+0].setX(key);
21520  result[i*2+0].setY(lastValue);
21521  }
21522  result[data.size()*2-1].setX(lastKey);
21523  result[data.size()*2-1].setY(lastValue);
21524  }
21525  return result;
21526 }
21527 
21538 QVector<QPointF> QCPGraph::dataToImpulseLines(const QVector<QCPGraphData> &data) const
21539 {
21540  QVector<QPointF> result;
21541  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
21542  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
21543  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return result; }
21544 
21545  result.resize(data.size()*2);
21546 
21547  // transform data points to pixels:
21548  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
21549  {
21550  for (int i=0; i<data.size(); ++i)
21551  {
21552  const QCPGraphData &current = data.at(i);
21553  if (!qIsNaN(current.value))
21554  {
21555  const double key = keyAxis->coordToPixel(current.key);
21556  result[i*2+0].setX(valueAxis->coordToPixel(0));
21557  result[i*2+0].setY(key);
21558  result[i*2+1].setX(valueAxis->coordToPixel(current.value));
21559  result[i*2+1].setY(key);
21560  } else
21561  {
21562  result[i*2+0] = QPointF(0, 0);
21563  result[i*2+1] = QPointF(0, 0);
21564  }
21565  }
21566  } else // key axis is horizontal
21567  {
21568  for (int i=0; i<data.size(); ++i)
21569  {
21570  const QCPGraphData &current = data.at(i);
21571  if (!qIsNaN(current.value))
21572  {
21573  const double key = keyAxis->coordToPixel(data.at(i).key);
21574  result[i*2+0].setX(key);
21575  result[i*2+0].setY(valueAxis->coordToPixel(0));
21576  result[i*2+1].setX(key);
21577  result[i*2+1].setY(valueAxis->coordToPixel(data.at(i).value));
21578  } else
21579  {
21580  result[i*2+0] = QPointF(0, 0);
21581  result[i*2+1] = QPointF(0, 0);
21582  }
21583  }
21584  }
21585  return result;
21586 }
21587 
21605 void QCPGraph::drawFill(QCPPainter *painter, QVector<QPointF> *lines) const
21606 {
21607  if (mLineStyle == lsImpulse) return; // fill doesn't make sense for impulse plot
21608  if (painter->brush().style() == Qt::NoBrush || painter->brush().color().alpha() == 0) return;
21609 
21610  applyFillAntialiasingHint(painter);
21611  const QVector<QCPDataRange> segments = getNonNanSegments(lines, keyAxis()->orientation());
21612  if (!mChannelFillGraph)
21613  {
21614  // draw base fill under graph, fill goes all the way to the zero-value-line:
21615  foreach (QCPDataRange segment, segments)
21616  painter->drawPolygon(getFillPolygon(lines, segment));
21617  } else
21618  {
21619  // draw fill between this graph and mChannelFillGraph:
21620  QVector<QPointF> otherLines;
21621  mChannelFillGraph->getLines(&otherLines, QCPDataRange(0, mChannelFillGraph->dataCount()));
21622  if (!otherLines.isEmpty())
21623  {
21624  QVector<QCPDataRange> otherSegments = getNonNanSegments(&otherLines, mChannelFillGraph->keyAxis()->orientation());
21625  QVector<QPair<QCPDataRange, QCPDataRange> > segmentPairs = getOverlappingSegments(segments, lines, otherSegments, &otherLines);
21626  for (int i=0; i<segmentPairs.size(); ++i)
21627  painter->drawPolygon(getChannelFillPolygon(lines, segmentPairs.at(i).first, &otherLines, segmentPairs.at(i).second));
21628  }
21629  }
21630 }
21631 
21639 void QCPGraph::drawScatterPlot(QCPPainter *painter, const QVector<QPointF> &scatters, const QCPScatterStyle &style) const
21640 {
21641  applyScattersAntialiasingHint(painter);
21642  style.applyTo(painter, mPen);
21643  foreach (const QPointF &scatter, scatters)
21644  style.drawShape(painter, scatter.x(), scatter.y());
21645 }
21646 
21653 void QCPGraph::drawLinePlot(QCPPainter *painter, const QVector<QPointF> &lines) const
21654 {
21655  if (painter->pen().style() != Qt::NoPen && painter->pen().color().alpha() != 0)
21656  {
21657  applyDefaultAntialiasingHint(painter);
21658  drawPolyline(painter, lines);
21659  }
21660 }
21661 
21670 void QCPGraph::drawImpulsePlot(QCPPainter *painter, const QVector<QPointF> &lines) const
21671 {
21672  if (painter->pen().style() != Qt::NoPen && painter->pen().color().alpha() != 0)
21673  {
21674  applyDefaultAntialiasingHint(painter);
21675  QPen oldPen = painter->pen();
21676  QPen newPen = painter->pen();
21677  newPen.setCapStyle(Qt::FlatCap); // so impulse line doesn't reach beyond zero-line
21678  painter->setPen(newPen);
21679  painter->drawLines(lines);
21680  painter->setPen(oldPen);
21681  }
21682 }
21683 
21696 void QCPGraph::getOptimizedLineData(QVector<QCPGraphData> *lineData, const QCPGraphDataContainer::const_iterator &begin, const QCPGraphDataContainer::const_iterator &end) const
21697 {
21698  if (!lineData) return;
21699  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
21700  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
21701  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return; }
21702  if (begin == end) return;
21703 
21704  int dataCount = int(end-begin);
21705  int maxCount = (std::numeric_limits<int>::max)();
21706  if (mAdaptiveSampling)
21707  {
21708  double keyPixelSpan = qAbs(keyAxis->coordToPixel(begin->key)-keyAxis->coordToPixel((end-1)->key));
21709  if (2*keyPixelSpan+2 < static_cast<double>((std::numeric_limits<int>::max)()))
21710  maxCount = int(2*keyPixelSpan+2);
21711  }
21712 
21713  if (mAdaptiveSampling && dataCount >= maxCount) // use adaptive sampling only if there are at least two points per pixel on average
21714  {
21715  QCPGraphDataContainer::const_iterator it = begin;
21716  double minValue = it->value;
21717  double maxValue = it->value;
21718  QCPGraphDataContainer::const_iterator currentIntervalFirstPoint = it;
21719  int reversedFactor = keyAxis->pixelOrientation(); // is used to calculate keyEpsilon pixel into the correct direction
21720  int reversedRound = reversedFactor==-1 ? 1 : 0; // is used to switch between floor (normal) and ceil (reversed) rounding of currentIntervalStartKey
21721  double currentIntervalStartKey = keyAxis->pixelToCoord(int(keyAxis->coordToPixel(begin->key)+reversedRound));
21722  double lastIntervalEndKey = currentIntervalStartKey;
21723  double keyEpsilon = qAbs(currentIntervalStartKey-keyAxis->pixelToCoord(keyAxis->coordToPixel(currentIntervalStartKey)+1.0*reversedFactor)); // interval of one pixel on screen when mapped to plot key coordinates
21724  bool keyEpsilonVariable = keyAxis->scaleType() == QCPAxis::stLogarithmic; // indicates whether keyEpsilon needs to be updated after every interval (for log axes)
21725  int intervalDataCount = 1;
21726  ++it; // advance iterator to second data point because adaptive sampling works in 1 point retrospect
21727  while (it != end)
21728  {
21729  if (it->key < currentIntervalStartKey+keyEpsilon) // data point is still within same pixel, so skip it and expand value span of this cluster if necessary
21730  {
21731  if (it->value < minValue)
21732  minValue = it->value;
21733  else if (it->value > maxValue)
21734  maxValue = it->value;
21735  ++intervalDataCount;
21736  } else // new pixel interval started
21737  {
21738  if (intervalDataCount >= 2) // last pixel had multiple data points, consolidate them to a cluster
21739  {
21740  if (lastIntervalEndKey < currentIntervalStartKey-keyEpsilon) // last point is further away, so first point of this cluster must be at a real data point
21741  lineData->append(QCPGraphData(currentIntervalStartKey+keyEpsilon*0.2, currentIntervalFirstPoint->value));
21742  lineData->append(QCPGraphData(currentIntervalStartKey+keyEpsilon*0.25, minValue));
21743  lineData->append(QCPGraphData(currentIntervalStartKey+keyEpsilon*0.75, maxValue));
21744  if (it->key > currentIntervalStartKey+keyEpsilon*2) // new pixel started further away from previous cluster, so make sure the last point of the cluster is at a real data point
21745  lineData->append(QCPGraphData(currentIntervalStartKey+keyEpsilon*0.8, (it-1)->value));
21746  } else
21747  lineData->append(QCPGraphData(currentIntervalFirstPoint->key, currentIntervalFirstPoint->value));
21748  lastIntervalEndKey = (it-1)->key;
21749  minValue = it->value;
21750  maxValue = it->value;
21751  currentIntervalFirstPoint = it;
21752  currentIntervalStartKey = keyAxis->pixelToCoord(int(keyAxis->coordToPixel(it->key)+reversedRound));
21753  if (keyEpsilonVariable)
21754  keyEpsilon = qAbs(currentIntervalStartKey-keyAxis->pixelToCoord(keyAxis->coordToPixel(currentIntervalStartKey)+1.0*reversedFactor));
21755  intervalDataCount = 1;
21756  }
21757  ++it;
21758  }
21759  // handle last interval:
21760  if (intervalDataCount >= 2) // last pixel had multiple data points, consolidate them to a cluster
21761  {
21762  if (lastIntervalEndKey < currentIntervalStartKey-keyEpsilon) // last point wasn't a cluster, so first point of this cluster must be at a real data point
21763  lineData->append(QCPGraphData(currentIntervalStartKey+keyEpsilon*0.2, currentIntervalFirstPoint->value));
21764  lineData->append(QCPGraphData(currentIntervalStartKey+keyEpsilon*0.25, minValue));
21765  lineData->append(QCPGraphData(currentIntervalStartKey+keyEpsilon*0.75, maxValue));
21766  } else
21767  lineData->append(QCPGraphData(currentIntervalFirstPoint->key, currentIntervalFirstPoint->value));
21768 
21769  } else // don't use adaptive sampling algorithm, transfer points one-to-one from the data container into the output
21770  {
21771  lineData->resize(dataCount);
21772  std::copy(begin, end, lineData->begin());
21773  }
21774 }
21775 
21788 void QCPGraph::getOptimizedScatterData(QVector<QCPGraphData> *scatterData, QCPGraphDataContainer::const_iterator begin, QCPGraphDataContainer::const_iterator end) const
21789 {
21790  if (!scatterData) return;
21791  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
21792  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
21793  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return; }
21794 
21795  const int scatterModulo = mScatterSkip+1;
21796  const bool doScatterSkip = mScatterSkip > 0;
21797  int beginIndex = int(begin-mDataContainer->constBegin());
21798  int endIndex = int(end-mDataContainer->constBegin());
21799  while (doScatterSkip && begin != end && beginIndex % scatterModulo != 0) // advance begin iterator to first non-skipped scatter
21800  {
21801  ++beginIndex;
21802  ++begin;
21803  }
21804  if (begin == end) return;
21805  int dataCount = int(end-begin);
21806  int maxCount = (std::numeric_limits<int>::max)();
21807  if (mAdaptiveSampling)
21808  {
21809  int keyPixelSpan = int(qAbs(keyAxis->coordToPixel(begin->key)-keyAxis->coordToPixel((end-1)->key)));
21810  maxCount = 2*keyPixelSpan+2;
21811  }
21812 
21813  if (mAdaptiveSampling && dataCount >= maxCount) // use adaptive sampling only if there are at least two points per pixel on average
21814  {
21815  double valueMaxRange = valueAxis->range().upper;
21816  double valueMinRange = valueAxis->range().lower;
21817  QCPGraphDataContainer::const_iterator it = begin;
21818  int itIndex = int(beginIndex);
21819  double minValue = it->value;
21820  double maxValue = it->value;
21821  QCPGraphDataContainer::const_iterator minValueIt = it;
21822  QCPGraphDataContainer::const_iterator maxValueIt = it;
21823  QCPGraphDataContainer::const_iterator currentIntervalStart = it;
21824  int reversedFactor = keyAxis->pixelOrientation(); // is used to calculate keyEpsilon pixel into the correct direction
21825  int reversedRound = reversedFactor==-1 ? 1 : 0; // is used to switch between floor (normal) and ceil (reversed) rounding of currentIntervalStartKey
21826  double currentIntervalStartKey = keyAxis->pixelToCoord(int(keyAxis->coordToPixel(begin->key)+reversedRound));
21827  double keyEpsilon = qAbs(currentIntervalStartKey-keyAxis->pixelToCoord(keyAxis->coordToPixel(currentIntervalStartKey)+1.0*reversedFactor)); // interval of one pixel on screen when mapped to plot key coordinates
21828  bool keyEpsilonVariable = keyAxis->scaleType() == QCPAxis::stLogarithmic; // indicates whether keyEpsilon needs to be updated after every interval (for log axes)
21829  int intervalDataCount = 1;
21830  // advance iterator to second (non-skipped) data point because adaptive sampling works in 1 point retrospect:
21831  if (!doScatterSkip)
21832  ++it;
21833  else
21834  {
21835  itIndex += scatterModulo;
21836  if (itIndex < endIndex) // make sure we didn't jump over end
21837  it += scatterModulo;
21838  else
21839  {
21840  it = end;
21841  itIndex = endIndex;
21842  }
21843  }
21844  // main loop over data points:
21845  while (it != end)
21846  {
21847  if (it->key < currentIntervalStartKey+keyEpsilon) // data point is still within same pixel, so skip it and expand value span of this pixel if necessary
21848  {
21849  if (it->value < minValue && it->value > valueMinRange && it->value < valueMaxRange)
21850  {
21851  minValue = it->value;
21852  minValueIt = it;
21853  } else if (it->value > maxValue && it->value > valueMinRange && it->value < valueMaxRange)
21854  {
21855  maxValue = it->value;
21856  maxValueIt = it;
21857  }
21858  ++intervalDataCount;
21859  } else // new pixel started
21860  {
21861  if (intervalDataCount >= 2) // last pixel had multiple data points, consolidate them
21862  {
21863  // determine value pixel span and add as many points in interval to maintain certain vertical data density (this is specific to scatter plot):
21864  double valuePixelSpan = qAbs(valueAxis->coordToPixel(minValue)-valueAxis->coordToPixel(maxValue));
21865  int dataModulo = qMax(1, qRound(intervalDataCount/(valuePixelSpan/4.0))); // approximately every 4 value pixels one data point on average
21866  QCPGraphDataContainer::const_iterator intervalIt = currentIntervalStart;
21867  int c = 0;
21868  while (intervalIt != it)
21869  {
21870  if ((c % dataModulo == 0 || intervalIt == minValueIt || intervalIt == maxValueIt) && intervalIt->value > valueMinRange && intervalIt->value < valueMaxRange)
21871  scatterData->append(*intervalIt);
21872  ++c;
21873  if (!doScatterSkip)
21874  ++intervalIt;
21875  else
21876  intervalIt += scatterModulo; // since we know indices of "currentIntervalStart", "intervalIt" and "it" are multiples of scatterModulo, we can't accidentally jump over "it" here
21877  }
21878  } else if (currentIntervalStart->value > valueMinRange && currentIntervalStart->value < valueMaxRange)
21879  scatterData->append(*currentIntervalStart);
21880  minValue = it->value;
21881  maxValue = it->value;
21882  currentIntervalStart = it;
21883  currentIntervalStartKey = keyAxis->pixelToCoord(int(keyAxis->coordToPixel(it->key)+reversedRound));
21884  if (keyEpsilonVariable)
21885  keyEpsilon = qAbs(currentIntervalStartKey-keyAxis->pixelToCoord(keyAxis->coordToPixel(currentIntervalStartKey)+1.0*reversedFactor));
21886  intervalDataCount = 1;
21887  }
21888  // advance to next data point:
21889  if (!doScatterSkip)
21890  ++it;
21891  else
21892  {
21893  itIndex += scatterModulo;
21894  if (itIndex < endIndex) // make sure we didn't jump over end
21895  it += scatterModulo;
21896  else
21897  {
21898  it = end;
21899  itIndex = endIndex;
21900  }
21901  }
21902  }
21903  // handle last interval:
21904  if (intervalDataCount >= 2) // last pixel had multiple data points, consolidate them
21905  {
21906  // determine value pixel span and add as many points in interval to maintain certain vertical data density (this is specific to scatter plot):
21907  double valuePixelSpan = qAbs(valueAxis->coordToPixel(minValue)-valueAxis->coordToPixel(maxValue));
21908  int dataModulo = qMax(1, qRound(intervalDataCount/(valuePixelSpan/4.0))); // approximately every 4 value pixels one data point on average
21909  QCPGraphDataContainer::const_iterator intervalIt = currentIntervalStart;
21910  int intervalItIndex = int(intervalIt-mDataContainer->constBegin());
21911  int c = 0;
21912  while (intervalIt != it)
21913  {
21914  if ((c % dataModulo == 0 || intervalIt == minValueIt || intervalIt == maxValueIt) && intervalIt->value > valueMinRange && intervalIt->value < valueMaxRange)
21915  scatterData->append(*intervalIt);
21916  ++c;
21917  if (!doScatterSkip)
21918  ++intervalIt;
21919  else // here we can't guarantee that adding scatterModulo doesn't exceed "it" (because "it" is equal to "end" here, and "end" isn't scatterModulo-aligned), so check via index comparison:
21920  {
21921  intervalItIndex += scatterModulo;
21922  if (intervalItIndex < itIndex)
21923  intervalIt += scatterModulo;
21924  else
21925  {
21926  intervalIt = it;
21927  intervalItIndex = itIndex;
21928  }
21929  }
21930  }
21931  } else if (currentIntervalStart->value > valueMinRange && currentIntervalStart->value < valueMaxRange)
21932  scatterData->append(*currentIntervalStart);
21933 
21934  } else // don't use adaptive sampling algorithm, transfer points one-to-one from the data container into the output
21935  {
21936  QCPGraphDataContainer::const_iterator it = begin;
21937  int itIndex = beginIndex;
21938  scatterData->reserve(dataCount);
21939  while (it != end)
21940  {
21941  scatterData->append(*it);
21942  // advance to next data point:
21943  if (!doScatterSkip)
21944  ++it;
21945  else
21946  {
21947  itIndex += scatterModulo;
21948  if (itIndex < endIndex)
21949  it += scatterModulo;
21950  else
21951  {
21952  it = end;
21953  itIndex = endIndex;
21954  }
21955  }
21956  }
21957  }
21958 }
21959 
21969 void QCPGraph::getVisibleDataBounds(QCPGraphDataContainer::const_iterator &begin, QCPGraphDataContainer::const_iterator &end, const QCPDataRange &rangeRestriction) const
21970 {
21971  if (rangeRestriction.isEmpty())
21972  {
21973  end = mDataContainer->constEnd();
21974  begin = end;
21975  } else
21976  {
21977  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
21978  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
21979  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return; }
21980  // get visible data range:
21981  begin = mDataContainer->findBegin(keyAxis->range().lower);
21982  end = mDataContainer->findEnd(keyAxis->range().upper);
21983  // limit lower/upperEnd to rangeRestriction:
21984  mDataContainer->limitIteratorsToDataRange(begin, end, rangeRestriction); // this also ensures rangeRestriction outside data bounds doesn't break anything
21985  }
21986 }
21987 
21999 QVector<QCPDataRange> QCPGraph::getNonNanSegments(const QVector<QPointF> *lineData, Qt::Orientation keyOrientation) const
22000 {
22001  QVector<QCPDataRange> result;
22002  const int n = lineData->size();
22003 
22004  QCPDataRange currentSegment(-1, -1);
22005  int i = 0;
22006 
22007  if (keyOrientation == Qt::Horizontal)
22008  {
22009  while (i < n)
22010  {
22011  while (i < n && qIsNaN(lineData->at(i).y())) // seek next non-NaN data point
22012  ++i;
22013  if (i == n)
22014  break;
22015  currentSegment.setBegin(i++);
22016  while (i < n && !qIsNaN(lineData->at(i).y())) // seek next NaN data point or end of data
22017  ++i;
22018  currentSegment.setEnd(i++);
22019  result.append(currentSegment);
22020  }
22021  } else // keyOrientation == Qt::Vertical
22022  {
22023  while (i < n)
22024  {
22025  while (i < n && qIsNaN(lineData->at(i).x())) // seek next non-NaN data point
22026  ++i;
22027  if (i == n)
22028  break;
22029  currentSegment.setBegin(i++);
22030  while (i < n && !qIsNaN(lineData->at(i).x())) // seek next NaN data point or end of data
22031  ++i;
22032  currentSegment.setEnd(i++);
22033  result.append(currentSegment);
22034  }
22035  }
22036  return result;
22037 }
22038 
22057 QVector<QPair<QCPDataRange, QCPDataRange> > QCPGraph::getOverlappingSegments(QVector<QCPDataRange> thisSegments, const QVector<QPointF> *thisData, QVector<QCPDataRange> otherSegments, const QVector<QPointF> *otherData) const
22058 {
22059  QVector<QPair<QCPDataRange, QCPDataRange> > result;
22060  if (thisData->isEmpty() || otherData->isEmpty() || thisSegments.isEmpty() || otherSegments.isEmpty())
22061  return result;
22062 
22063  int thisIndex = 0;
22064  int otherIndex = 0;
22065  const bool verticalKey = mKeyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical;
22066  while (thisIndex < thisSegments.size() && otherIndex < otherSegments.size())
22067  {
22068  if (thisSegments.at(thisIndex).size() < 2) // segments with fewer than two points won't have a fill anyhow
22069  {
22070  ++thisIndex;
22071  continue;
22072  }
22073  if (otherSegments.at(otherIndex).size() < 2) // segments with fewer than two points won't have a fill anyhow
22074  {
22075  ++otherIndex;
22076  continue;
22077  }
22078  double thisLower, thisUpper, otherLower, otherUpper;
22079  if (!verticalKey)
22080  {
22081  thisLower = thisData->at(thisSegments.at(thisIndex).begin()).x();
22082  thisUpper = thisData->at(thisSegments.at(thisIndex).end()-1).x();
22083  otherLower = otherData->at(otherSegments.at(otherIndex).begin()).x();
22084  otherUpper = otherData->at(otherSegments.at(otherIndex).end()-1).x();
22085  } else
22086  {
22087  thisLower = thisData->at(thisSegments.at(thisIndex).begin()).y();
22088  thisUpper = thisData->at(thisSegments.at(thisIndex).end()-1).y();
22089  otherLower = otherData->at(otherSegments.at(otherIndex).begin()).y();
22090  otherUpper = otherData->at(otherSegments.at(otherIndex).end()-1).y();
22091  }
22092 
22093  int bPrecedence;
22094  if (segmentsIntersect(thisLower, thisUpper, otherLower, otherUpper, bPrecedence))
22095  result.append(QPair<QCPDataRange, QCPDataRange>(thisSegments.at(thisIndex), otherSegments.at(otherIndex)));
22096 
22097  if (bPrecedence <= 0) // otherSegment doesn't reach as far as thisSegment, so continue with next otherSegment, keeping current thisSegment
22098  ++otherIndex;
22099  else // otherSegment reaches further than thisSegment, so continue with next thisSegment, keeping current otherSegment
22100  ++thisIndex;
22101  }
22102 
22103  return result;
22104 }
22105 
22120 bool QCPGraph::segmentsIntersect(double aLower, double aUpper, double bLower, double bUpper, int &bPrecedence) const
22121 {
22122  bPrecedence = 0;
22123  if (aLower > bUpper)
22124  {
22125  bPrecedence = -1;
22126  return false;
22127  } else if (bLower > aUpper)
22128  {
22129  bPrecedence = 1;
22130  return false;
22131  } else
22132  {
22133  if (aUpper > bUpper)
22134  bPrecedence = -1;
22135  else if (aUpper < bUpper)
22136  bPrecedence = 1;
22137 
22138  return true;
22139  }
22140 }
22141 
22153 QPointF QCPGraph::getFillBasePoint(QPointF matchingDataPoint) const
22154 {
22155  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
22156  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
22157  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return {}; }
22158 
22159  QPointF result;
22160  if (valueAxis->scaleType() == QCPAxis::stLinear)
22161  {
22162  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Horizontal)
22163  {
22164  result.setX(matchingDataPoint.x());
22165  result.setY(valueAxis->coordToPixel(0));
22166  } else // keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical
22167  {
22168  result.setX(valueAxis->coordToPixel(0));
22169  result.setY(matchingDataPoint.y());
22170  }
22171  } else // valueAxis->mScaleType == QCPAxis::stLogarithmic
22172  {
22173  // In logarithmic scaling we can't just draw to value 0 so we just fill all the way
22174  // to the axis which is in the direction towards 0
22175  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
22176  {
22177  if ((valueAxis->range().upper < 0 && !valueAxis->rangeReversed()) ||
22178  (valueAxis->range().upper > 0 && valueAxis->rangeReversed())) // if range is negative, zero is on opposite side of key axis
22179  result.setX(keyAxis->axisRect()->right());
22180  else
22181  result.setX(keyAxis->axisRect()->left());
22182  result.setY(matchingDataPoint.y());
22183  } else if (keyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atTop || keyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atBottom)
22184  {
22185  result.setX(matchingDataPoint.x());
22186  if ((valueAxis->range().upper < 0 && !valueAxis->rangeReversed()) ||
22187  (valueAxis->range().upper > 0 && valueAxis->rangeReversed())) // if range is negative, zero is on opposite side of key axis
22188  result.setY(keyAxis->axisRect()->top());
22189  else
22190  result.setY(keyAxis->axisRect()->bottom());
22191  }
22192  }
22193  return result;
22194 }
22195 
22212 const QPolygonF QCPGraph::getFillPolygon(const QVector<QPointF> *lineData, QCPDataRange segment) const
22213 {
22214  if (segment.size() < 2)
22215  return QPolygonF();
22216  QPolygonF result(segment.size()+2);
22217 
22218  result[0] = getFillBasePoint(lineData->at(segment.begin()));
22219  std::copy(lineData->constBegin()+segment.begin(), lineData->constBegin()+segment.end(), result.begin()+1);
22220  result[result.size()-1] = getFillBasePoint(lineData->at(segment.end()-1));
22221 
22222  return result;
22223 }
22224 
22243 const QPolygonF QCPGraph::getChannelFillPolygon(const QVector<QPointF> *thisData, QCPDataRange thisSegment, const QVector<QPointF> *otherData, QCPDataRange otherSegment) const
22244 {
22245  if (!mChannelFillGraph)
22246  return QPolygonF();
22247 
22248  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
22249  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
22250  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return QPolygonF(); }
22251  if (!mChannelFillGraph.data()->mKeyAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "channel fill target key axis invalid"; return QPolygonF(); }
22252 
22253  if (mChannelFillGraph.data()->mKeyAxis.data()->orientation() != keyAxis->orientation())
22254  return QPolygonF(); // don't have same axis orientation, can't fill that (Note: if keyAxis fits, valueAxis will fit too, because it's always orthogonal to keyAxis)
22255 
22256  if (thisData->isEmpty()) return QPolygonF();
22257  QVector<QPointF> thisSegmentData(thisSegment.size());
22258  QVector<QPointF> otherSegmentData(otherSegment.size());
22259  std::copy(thisData->constBegin()+thisSegment.begin(), thisData->constBegin()+thisSegment.end(), thisSegmentData.begin());
22260  std::copy(otherData->constBegin()+otherSegment.begin(), otherData->constBegin()+otherSegment.end(), otherSegmentData.begin());
22261  // pointers to be able to swap them, depending which data range needs cropping:
22262  QVector<QPointF> *staticData = &thisSegmentData;
22263  QVector<QPointF> *croppedData = &otherSegmentData;
22264 
22265  // crop both vectors to ranges in which the keys overlap (which coord is key, depends on axisType):
22266  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Horizontal)
22267  {
22268  // x is key
22269  // crop lower bound:
22270  if (staticData->first().x() < croppedData->first().x()) // other one must be cropped
22271  qSwap(staticData, croppedData);
22272  const int lowBound = findIndexBelowX(croppedData, staticData->first().x());
22273  if (lowBound == -1) return QPolygonF(); // key ranges have no overlap
22274  croppedData->remove(0, lowBound);
22275  // set lowest point of cropped data to fit exactly key position of first static data point via linear interpolation:
22276  if (croppedData->size() < 2) return QPolygonF(); // need at least two points for interpolation
22277  double slope;
22278  if (!qFuzzyCompare(croppedData->at(1).x(), croppedData->at(0).x()))
22279  slope = (croppedData->at(1).y()-croppedData->at(0).y())/(croppedData->at(1).x()-croppedData->at(0).x());
22280  else
22281  slope = 0;
22282  (*croppedData)[0].setY(croppedData->at(0).y()+slope*(staticData->first().x()-croppedData->at(0).x()));
22283  (*croppedData)[0].setX(staticData->first().x());
22284 
22285  // crop upper bound:
22286  if (staticData->last().x() > croppedData->last().x()) // other one must be cropped
22287  qSwap(staticData, croppedData);
22288  int highBound = findIndexAboveX(croppedData, staticData->last().x());
22289  if (highBound == -1) return QPolygonF(); // key ranges have no overlap
22290  croppedData->remove(highBound+1, croppedData->size()-(highBound+1));
22291  // set highest point of cropped data to fit exactly key position of last static data point via linear interpolation:
22292  if (croppedData->size() < 2) return QPolygonF(); // need at least two points for interpolation
22293  const int li = croppedData->size()-1; // last index
22294  if (!qFuzzyCompare(croppedData->at(li).x(), croppedData->at(li-1).x()))
22295  slope = (croppedData->at(li).y()-croppedData->at(li-1).y())/(croppedData->at(li).x()-croppedData->at(li-1).x());
22296  else
22297  slope = 0;
22298  (*croppedData)[li].setY(croppedData->at(li-1).y()+slope*(staticData->last().x()-croppedData->at(li-1).x()));
22299  (*croppedData)[li].setX(staticData->last().x());
22300  } else // mKeyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical
22301  {
22302  // y is key
22303  // crop lower bound:
22304  if (staticData->first().y() < croppedData->first().y()) // other one must be cropped
22305  qSwap(staticData, croppedData);
22306  int lowBound = findIndexBelowY(croppedData, staticData->first().y());
22307  if (lowBound == -1) return QPolygonF(); // key ranges have no overlap
22308  croppedData->remove(0, lowBound);
22309  // set lowest point of cropped data to fit exactly key position of first static data point via linear interpolation:
22310  if (croppedData->size() < 2) return QPolygonF(); // need at least two points for interpolation
22311  double slope;
22312  if (!qFuzzyCompare(croppedData->at(1).y(), croppedData->at(0).y())) // avoid division by zero in step plots
22313  slope = (croppedData->at(1).x()-croppedData->at(0).x())/(croppedData->at(1).y()-croppedData->at(0).y());
22314  else
22315  slope = 0;
22316  (*croppedData)[0].setX(croppedData->at(0).x()+slope*(staticData->first().y()-croppedData->at(0).y()));
22317  (*croppedData)[0].setY(staticData->first().y());
22318 
22319  // crop upper bound:
22320  if (staticData->last().y() > croppedData->last().y()) // other one must be cropped
22321  qSwap(staticData, croppedData);
22322  int highBound = findIndexAboveY(croppedData, staticData->last().y());
22323  if (highBound == -1) return QPolygonF(); // key ranges have no overlap
22324  croppedData->remove(highBound+1, croppedData->size()-(highBound+1));
22325  // set highest point of cropped data to fit exactly key position of last static data point via linear interpolation:
22326  if (croppedData->size() < 2) return QPolygonF(); // need at least two points for interpolation
22327  int li = croppedData->size()-1; // last index
22328  if (!qFuzzyCompare(croppedData->at(li).y(), croppedData->at(li-1).y())) // avoid division by zero in step plots
22329  slope = (croppedData->at(li).x()-croppedData->at(li-1).x())/(croppedData->at(li).y()-croppedData->at(li-1).y());
22330  else
22331  slope = 0;
22332  (*croppedData)[li].setX(croppedData->at(li-1).x()+slope*(staticData->last().y()-croppedData->at(li-1).y()));
22333  (*croppedData)[li].setY(staticData->last().y());
22334  }
22335 
22336  // return joined:
22337  for (int i=otherSegmentData.size()-1; i>=0; --i) // insert reversed, otherwise the polygon will be twisted
22338  thisSegmentData << otherSegmentData.at(i);
22339  return QPolygonF(thisSegmentData);
22340 }
22341 
22350 int QCPGraph::findIndexAboveX(const QVector<QPointF> *data, double x) const
22351 {
22352  for (int i=data->size()-1; i>=0; --i)
22353  {
22354  if (data->at(i).x() < x)
22355  {
22356  if (i<data->size()-1)
22357  return i+1;
22358  else
22359  return data->size()-1;
22360  }
22361  }
22362  return -1;
22363 }
22364 
22373 int QCPGraph::findIndexBelowX(const QVector<QPointF> *data, double x) const
22374 {
22375  for (int i=0; i<data->size(); ++i)
22376  {
22377  if (data->at(i).x() > x)
22378  {
22379  if (i>0)
22380  return i-1;
22381  else
22382  return 0;
22383  }
22384  }
22385  return -1;
22386 }
22387 
22396 int QCPGraph::findIndexAboveY(const QVector<QPointF> *data, double y) const
22397 {
22398  for (int i=data->size()-1; i>=0; --i)
22399  {
22400  if (data->at(i).y() < y)
22401  {
22402  if (i<data->size()-1)
22403  return i+1;
22404  else
22405  return data->size()-1;
22406  }
22407  }
22408  return -1;
22409 }
22410 
22422 double QCPGraph::pointDistance(const QPointF &pixelPoint, QCPGraphDataContainer::const_iterator &closestData) const
22423 {
22424  closestData = mDataContainer->constEnd();
22425  if (mDataContainer->isEmpty())
22426  return -1.0;
22427  if (mLineStyle == lsNone && mScatterStyle.isNone())
22428  return -1.0;
22429 
22430  // calculate minimum distances to graph data points and find closestData iterator:
22431  double minDistSqr = (std::numeric_limits<double>::max)();
22432  // determine which key range comes into question, taking selection tolerance around pos into account:
22433  double posKeyMin, posKeyMax, dummy;
22434  pixelsToCoords(pixelPoint-QPointF(mParentPlot->selectionTolerance(), mParentPlot->selectionTolerance()), posKeyMin, dummy);
22435  pixelsToCoords(pixelPoint+QPointF(mParentPlot->selectionTolerance(), mParentPlot->selectionTolerance()), posKeyMax, dummy);
22436  if (posKeyMin > posKeyMax)
22437  qSwap(posKeyMin, posKeyMax);
22438  // iterate over found data points and then choose the one with the shortest distance to pos:
22439  QCPGraphDataContainer::const_iterator begin = mDataContainer->findBegin(posKeyMin, true);
22440  QCPGraphDataContainer::const_iterator end = mDataContainer->findEnd(posKeyMax, true);
22441  for (QCPGraphDataContainer::const_iterator it=begin; it!=end; ++it)
22442  {
22443  const double currentDistSqr = QCPVector2D(coordsToPixels(it->key, it->value)-pixelPoint).lengthSquared();
22444  if (currentDistSqr < minDistSqr)
22445  {
22446  minDistSqr = currentDistSqr;
22447  closestData = it;
22448  }
22449  }
22450 
22451  // calculate distance to graph line if there is one (if so, will probably be smaller than distance to closest data point):
22452  if (mLineStyle != lsNone)
22453  {
22454  // line displayed, calculate distance to line segments:
22455  QVector<QPointF> lineData;
22456  getLines(&lineData, QCPDataRange(0, dataCount())); // don't limit data range further since with sharp data spikes, line segments may be closer to test point than segments with closer key coordinate
22457  QCPVector2D p(pixelPoint);
22458  const int step = mLineStyle==lsImpulse ? 2 : 1; // impulse plot differs from other line styles in that the lineData points are only pairwise connected
22459  for (int i=0; i<lineData.size()-1; i+=step)
22460  {
22461  const double currentDistSqr = p.distanceSquaredToLine(lineData.at(i), lineData.at(i+1));
22462  if (currentDistSqr < minDistSqr)
22463  minDistSqr = currentDistSqr;
22464  }
22465  }
22466 
22467  return qSqrt(minDistSqr);
22468 }
22469 
22478 int QCPGraph::findIndexBelowY(const QVector<QPointF> *data, double y) const
22479 {
22480  for (int i=0; i<data->size(); ++i)
22481  {
22482  if (data->at(i).y() > y)
22483  {
22484  if (i>0)
22485  return i-1;
22486  else
22487  return 0;
22488  }
22489  }
22490  return -1;
22491 }
22492 /* end of 'src/plottables/plottable-graph.cpp' */
22493

22496 /* modified 2022-11-06T12:45:56, size 63851 */

22653 QCPCurve::QCPCurve(QCPAxis *keyAxis, QCPAxis *valueAxis) :
22654  QCPAbstractPlottable1D<QCPCurveData>(keyAxis, valueAxis),
22655  mScatterSkip{},
22656  mLineStyle{}
22657 {
22658  // modify inherited properties from abstract plottable:
22659  setPen(QPen(Qt::blue, 0));
22660  setBrush(Qt::NoBrush);
22661 
22662  setScatterStyle(QCPScatterStyle());
22663  setLineStyle(lsLine);
22664  setScatterSkip(0);
22665 }

22689 }

22702 void QCPCurve::setData(const QVector<double> &t, const QVector<double> &keys, const QVector<double> &values, bool alreadySorted)
22703 {

22720 void QCPCurve::setData(const QVector<double> &keys, const QVector<double> &values)
