22765 
22778 void QCPCurve::addData(const QVector<double> &t, const QVector<double> &keys, const QVector<double> &values, bool alreadySorted)
22779 {
22780  if (t.size() != keys.size() || t.size() != values.size())
22781  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "ts, keys and values have different sizes:" << t.size() << keys.size() << values.size();
22782  const int n = qMin(qMin(t.size(), keys.size()), values.size());
22783  QVector<QCPCurveData> tempData(n);
22784  QVector<QCPCurveData>::iterator it = tempData.begin();
22785  const QVector<QCPCurveData>::iterator itEnd = tempData.end();
22786  int i = 0;
22787  while (it != itEnd)
22788  {
22789  it->t = t[i];
22790  it->key = keys[i];
22791  it->value = values[i];
22792  ++it;
22793  ++i;
22794  }
22795  mDataContainer->add(tempData, alreadySorted); // don't modify tempData beyond this to prevent copy on write
22796 }
22797 
22810 void QCPCurve::addData(const QVector<double> &keys, const QVector<double> &values)
22811 {
22812  if (keys.size() != values.size())
22813  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "keys and values have different sizes:" << keys.size() << values.size();
22814  const int n = qMin(keys.size(), values.size());
22815  double tStart;
22816  if (!mDataContainer->isEmpty())
22817  tStart = (mDataContainer->constEnd()-1)->t + 1.0;
22818  else
22819  tStart = 0;
22820  QVector<QCPCurveData> tempData(n);
22821  QVector<QCPCurveData>::iterator it = tempData.begin();
22822  const QVector<QCPCurveData>::iterator itEnd = tempData.end();
22823  int i = 0;
22824  while (it != itEnd)
22825  {
22826  it->t = tStart + i;
22827  it->key = keys[i];
22828  it->value = values[i];
22829  ++it;
22830  ++i;
22831  }
22832  mDataContainer->add(tempData, true); // don't modify tempData beyond this to prevent copy on write
22833 }
22834 
22841 void QCPCurve::addData(double t, double key, double value)
22842 {
22843  mDataContainer->add(QCPCurveData(t, key, value));
22844 }
22845 
22856 void QCPCurve::addData(double key, double value)
22857 {
22858  if (!mDataContainer->isEmpty())
22859  mDataContainer->add(QCPCurveData((mDataContainer->constEnd()-1)->t + 1.0, key, value));
22860  else
22861  mDataContainer->add(QCPCurveData(0.0, key, value));
22862 }
22863 
22872 double QCPCurve::selectTest(const QPointF &pos, bool onlySelectable, QVariant *details) const
22873 {
22874  if ((onlySelectable && mSelectable == QCP::stNone) || mDataContainer->isEmpty())
22875  return -1;
22876  if (!mKeyAxis || !mValueAxis)
22877  return -1;
22878 
22879  if (mKeyAxis.data()->axisRect()->rect().contains(pos.toPoint()) || mParentPlot->interactions().testFlag(QCP::iSelectPlottablesBeyondAxisRect))
22880  {
22881  QCPCurveDataContainer::const_iterator closestDataPoint = mDataContainer->constEnd();
22882  double result = pointDistance(pos, closestDataPoint);
22883  if (details)
22884  {
22885  int pointIndex = int( closestDataPoint-mDataContainer->constBegin() );
22886  details->setValue(QCPDataSelection(QCPDataRange(pointIndex, pointIndex+1)));
22887  }
22888  return result;
22889  } else
22890  return -1;
22891 }
22892 
22893 /* inherits documentation from base class */
22894 QCPRange QCPCurve::getKeyRange(bool &foundRange, QCP::SignDomain inSignDomain) const
22895 {
22896  return mDataContainer->keyRange(foundRange, inSignDomain);
22897 }
22898 
22899 /* inherits documentation from base class */
22900 QCPRange QCPCurve::getValueRange(bool &foundRange, QCP::SignDomain inSignDomain, const QCPRange &inKeyRange) const
22901 {
22902  return mDataContainer->valueRange(foundRange, inSignDomain, inKeyRange);
22903 }
22904 
22905 /* inherits documentation from base class */
22906 void QCPCurve::draw(QCPPainter *painter)
22907 {
22908  if (mDataContainer->isEmpty()) return;
22909 
22910  // allocate line vector:
22911  QVector<QPointF> lines, scatters;
22912 
22913  // loop over and draw segments of unselected/selected data:
22914  QList<QCPDataRange> selectedSegments, unselectedSegments, allSegments;
22915  getDataSegments(selectedSegments, unselectedSegments);
22916  allSegments << unselectedSegments << selectedSegments;
22917  for (int i=0; i<allSegments.size(); ++i)
22918  {
22919  bool isSelectedSegment = i >= unselectedSegments.size();
22920 
22921  // fill with curve data:
22922  QPen finalCurvePen = mPen; // determine the final pen already here, because the line optimization depends on its stroke width
22923  if (isSelectedSegment && mSelectionDecorator)
22924  finalCurvePen = mSelectionDecorator->pen();
22925 
22926  QCPDataRange lineDataRange = isSelectedSegment ? allSegments.at(i) : allSegments.at(i).adjusted(-1, 1); // unselected segments extend lines to bordering selected data point (safe to exceed total data bounds in first/last segment, getCurveLines takes care)
22927  getCurveLines(&lines, lineDataRange, finalCurvePen.widthF());
22928 
22929  // check data validity if flag set:
22930  #ifdef QCUSTOMPLOT_CHECK_DATA
22931  for (QCPCurveDataContainer::const_iterator it = mDataContainer->constBegin(); it != mDataContainer->constEnd(); ++it)
22932  {
22933  if (QCP::isInvalidData(it->t) ||
22934  QCP::isInvalidData(it->key, it->value))
22935  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "Data point at" << it->key << "invalid." << "Plottable name:" << name();
22936  }
22937  #endif
22938 
22939  // draw curve fill:
22940  applyFillAntialiasingHint(painter);
22941  if (isSelectedSegment && mSelectionDecorator)
22942  mSelectionDecorator->applyBrush(painter);
22943  else
22944  painter->setBrush(mBrush);
22945  painter->setPen(Qt::NoPen);
22946  if (painter->brush().style() != Qt::NoBrush && painter->brush().color().alpha() != 0)
22947  painter->drawPolygon(QPolygonF(lines));
22948 
22949  // draw curve line:
22950  if (mLineStyle != lsNone)
22951  {
22952  painter->setPen(finalCurvePen);
22953  painter->setBrush(Qt::NoBrush);
22954  drawCurveLine(painter, lines);
22955  }
22956 
22957  // draw scatters:
22958  QCPScatterStyle finalScatterStyle = mScatterStyle;
22959  if (isSelectedSegment && mSelectionDecorator)
22960  finalScatterStyle = mSelectionDecorator->getFinalScatterStyle(mScatterStyle);
22961  if (!finalScatterStyle.isNone())
22962  {
22963  getScatters(&scatters, allSegments.at(i), finalScatterStyle.size());
22964  drawScatterPlot(painter, scatters, finalScatterStyle);
22965  }
22966  }
22967 
22968  // draw other selection decoration that isn't just line/scatter pens and brushes:
22969  if (mSelectionDecorator)
22970  mSelectionDecorator->drawDecoration(painter, selection());
22971 }
22972 
22973 /* inherits documentation from base class */
22974 void QCPCurve::drawLegendIcon(QCPPainter *painter, const QRectF &rect) const
22975 {
22976  // draw fill:
22977  if (mBrush.style() != Qt::NoBrush)
22978  {
22979  applyFillAntialiasingHint(painter);
22980  painter->fillRect(QRectF(rect.left(), rect.top()+rect.height()/2.0, rect.width(), rect.height()/3.0), mBrush);
22981  }
22982  // draw line vertically centered:
22983  if (mLineStyle != lsNone)
22984  {
22985  applyDefaultAntialiasingHint(painter);
22986  painter->setPen(mPen);
22987  painter->drawLine(QLineF(rect.left(), rect.top()+rect.height()/2.0, rect.right()+5, rect.top()+rect.height()/2.0)); // +5 on x2 else last segment is missing from dashed/dotted pens
22988  }
22989  // draw scatter symbol:
22990  if (!mScatterStyle.isNone())
22991  {
22992  applyScattersAntialiasingHint(painter);
22993  // scale scatter pixmap if it's too large to fit in legend icon rect:
22994  if (mScatterStyle.shape() == QCPScatterStyle::ssPixmap && (mScatterStyle.pixmap().size().width() > rect.width() || mScatterStyle.pixmap().size().height() > rect.height()))
22995  {
22996  QCPScatterStyle scaledStyle(mScatterStyle);
22997  scaledStyle.setPixmap(scaledStyle.pixmap().scaled(rect.size().toSize(), Qt::KeepAspectRatio, Qt::SmoothTransformation));
22998  scaledStyle.applyTo(painter, mPen);
22999  scaledStyle.drawShape(painter, QRectF(rect).center());
23000  } else
23001  {
23002  mScatterStyle.applyTo(painter, mPen);
23003  mScatterStyle.drawShape(painter, QRectF(rect).center());
23004  }
23005  }
23006 }
23007 
23014 void QCPCurve::drawCurveLine(QCPPainter *painter, const QVector<QPointF> &lines) const
23015 {
23016  if (painter->pen().style() != Qt::NoPen && painter->pen().color().alpha() != 0)
23017  {
23018  applyDefaultAntialiasingHint(painter);
23019  drawPolyline(painter, lines);
23020  }
23021 }
23022 
23030 void QCPCurve::drawScatterPlot(QCPPainter *painter, const QVector<QPointF> &points, const QCPScatterStyle &style) const
23031 {
23032  // draw scatter point symbols:
23033  applyScattersAntialiasingHint(painter);
23034  style.applyTo(painter, mPen);
23035  foreach (const QPointF &point, points)
23036  if (!qIsNaN(point.x()) && !qIsNaN(point.y()))
23037  style.drawShape(painter, point);
23038 }
23039 
23068 void QCPCurve::getCurveLines(QVector<QPointF> *lines, const QCPDataRange &dataRange, double penWidth) const
23069 {
23070  if (!lines) return;
23071  lines->clear();
23072  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
23073  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
23074  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return; }
23075 
23076  // add margins to rect to compensate for stroke width
23077  const double strokeMargin = qMax(qreal(1.0), qreal(penWidth*0.75)); // stroke radius + 50% safety
23078  const double keyMin = keyAxis->pixelToCoord(keyAxis->coordToPixel(keyAxis->range().lower)-strokeMargin*keyAxis->pixelOrientation());
23079  const double keyMax = keyAxis->pixelToCoord(keyAxis->coordToPixel(keyAxis->range().upper)+strokeMargin*keyAxis->pixelOrientation());
23080  const double valueMin = valueAxis->pixelToCoord(valueAxis->coordToPixel(valueAxis->range().lower)-strokeMargin*valueAxis->pixelOrientation());
23081  const double valueMax = valueAxis->pixelToCoord(valueAxis->coordToPixel(valueAxis->range().upper)+strokeMargin*valueAxis->pixelOrientation());
23082  QCPCurveDataContainer::const_iterator itBegin = mDataContainer->constBegin();
23083  QCPCurveDataContainer::const_iterator itEnd = mDataContainer->constEnd();
23084  mDataContainer->limitIteratorsToDataRange(itBegin, itEnd, dataRange);
23085  if (itBegin == itEnd)
23086  return;
23087  QCPCurveDataContainer::const_iterator it = itBegin;
23088  QCPCurveDataContainer::const_iterator prevIt = itEnd-1;
23089  int prevRegion = getRegion(prevIt->key, prevIt->value, keyMin, valueMax, keyMax, valueMin);
23090  QVector<QPointF> trailingPoints; // points that must be applied after all other points (are generated only when handling first point to get virtual segment between last and first point right)
23091  while (it != itEnd)
23092  {
23093  const int currentRegion = getRegion(it->key, it->value, keyMin, valueMax, keyMax, valueMin);
23094  if (currentRegion != prevRegion) // changed region, possibly need to add some optimized edge points or original points if entering R
23095  {
23096  if (currentRegion != 5) // segment doesn't end in R, so it's a candidate for removal
23097  {
23098  QPointF crossA, crossB;
23099  if (prevRegion == 5) // we're coming from R, so add this point optimized
23100  {
23101  lines->append(getOptimizedPoint(currentRegion, it->key, it->value, prevIt->key, prevIt->value, keyMin, valueMax, keyMax, valueMin));
23102  // in the situations 5->1/7/9/3 the segment may leave R and directly cross through two outer regions. In these cases we need to add an additional corner point
23103  *lines << getOptimizedCornerPoints(prevRegion, currentRegion, prevIt->key, prevIt->value, it->key, it->value, keyMin, valueMax, keyMax, valueMin);
23104  } else if (mayTraverse(prevRegion, currentRegion) &&
23105  getTraverse(prevIt->key, prevIt->value, it->key, it->value, keyMin, valueMax, keyMax, valueMin, crossA, crossB))
23106  {
23107  // add the two cross points optimized if segment crosses R and if segment isn't virtual zeroth segment between last and first curve point:
23108  QVector<QPointF> beforeTraverseCornerPoints, afterTraverseCornerPoints;
23109  getTraverseCornerPoints(prevRegion, currentRegion, keyMin, valueMax, keyMax, valueMin, beforeTraverseCornerPoints, afterTraverseCornerPoints);
23110  if (it != itBegin)
23111  {
23112  *lines << beforeTraverseCornerPoints;
23113  lines->append(crossA);
23114  lines->append(crossB);
23115  *lines << afterTraverseCornerPoints;
23116  } else
23117  {
23118  lines->append(crossB);
23119  *lines << afterTraverseCornerPoints;
23120  trailingPoints << beforeTraverseCornerPoints << crossA ;
23121  }
23122  } else // doesn't cross R, line is just moving around in outside regions, so only need to add optimized point(s) at the boundary corner(s)
23123  {
23124  *lines << getOptimizedCornerPoints(prevRegion, currentRegion, prevIt->key, prevIt->value, it->key, it->value, keyMin, valueMax, keyMax, valueMin);
23125  }
23126  } else // segment does end in R, so we add previous point optimized and this point at original position
23127  {
23128  if (it == itBegin) // it is first point in curve and prevIt is last one. So save optimized point for adding it to the lineData in the end
23129  trailingPoints << getOptimizedPoint(prevRegion, prevIt->key, prevIt->value, it->key, it->value, keyMin, valueMax, keyMax, valueMin);
23130  else
23131  lines->append(getOptimizedPoint(prevRegion, prevIt->key, prevIt->value, it->key, it->value, keyMin, valueMax, keyMax, valueMin));
23132  lines->append(coordsToPixels(it->key, it->value));
23133  }
23134  } else // region didn't change
23135  {
23136  if (currentRegion == 5) // still in R, keep adding original points
23137  {
23138  lines->append(coordsToPixels(it->key, it->value));
23139  } else // still outside R, no need to add anything
23140  {
23141  // see how this is not doing anything? That's the main optimization...
23142  }
23143  }
23144  prevIt = it;
23145  prevRegion = currentRegion;
23146  ++it;
23147  }
23148  *lines << trailingPoints;
23149 }
23150 
23171 void QCPCurve::getScatters(QVector<QPointF> *scatters, const QCPDataRange &dataRange, double scatterWidth) const
23172 {
23173  if (!scatters) return;
23174  scatters->clear();
23175  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
23176  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
23177  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return; }
23178 
23179  QCPCurveDataContainer::const_iterator begin = mDataContainer->constBegin();
23180  QCPCurveDataContainer::const_iterator end = mDataContainer->constEnd();
23181  mDataContainer->limitIteratorsToDataRange(begin, end, dataRange);
23182  if (begin == end)
23183  return;
23184  const int scatterModulo = mScatterSkip+1;
23185  const bool doScatterSkip = mScatterSkip > 0;
23186  int endIndex = int( end-mDataContainer->constBegin() );
23187 
23188  QCPRange keyRange = keyAxis->range();
23189  QCPRange valueRange = valueAxis->range();
23190  // extend range to include width of scatter symbols:
23191  keyRange.lower = keyAxis->pixelToCoord(keyAxis->coordToPixel(keyRange.lower)-scatterWidth*keyAxis->pixelOrientation());
23192  keyRange.upper = keyAxis->pixelToCoord(keyAxis->coordToPixel(keyRange.upper)+scatterWidth*keyAxis->pixelOrientation());
23193  valueRange.lower = valueAxis->pixelToCoord(valueAxis->coordToPixel(valueRange.lower)-scatterWidth*valueAxis->pixelOrientation());
23194  valueRange.upper = valueAxis->pixelToCoord(valueAxis->coordToPixel(valueRange.upper)+scatterWidth*valueAxis->pixelOrientation());
23195 
23196  QCPCurveDataContainer::const_iterator it = begin;
23197  int itIndex = int( begin-mDataContainer->constBegin() );
23198  while (doScatterSkip && it != end && itIndex % scatterModulo != 0) // advance begin iterator to first non-skipped scatter
23199  {
23200  ++itIndex;
23201  ++it;
23202  }
23203  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
23204  {
23205  while (it != end)
23206  {
23207  if (!qIsNaN(it->value) && keyRange.contains(it->key) && valueRange.contains(it->value))
23208  scatters->append(QPointF(valueAxis->coordToPixel(it->value), keyAxis->coordToPixel(it->key)));
23209 
23210  // advance iterator to next (non-skipped) data point:
23211  if (!doScatterSkip)
23212  ++it;
23213  else
23214  {
23215  itIndex += scatterModulo;
23216  if (itIndex < endIndex) // make sure we didn't jump over end
23217  it += scatterModulo;
23218  else
23219  {
23220  it = end;
23221  itIndex = endIndex;
23222  }
23223  }
23224  }
23225  } else
23226  {
23227  while (it != end)
23228  {
23229  if (!qIsNaN(it->value) && keyRange.contains(it->key) && valueRange.contains(it->value))
23230  scatters->append(QPointF(keyAxis->coordToPixel(it->key), valueAxis->coordToPixel(it->value)));
23231 
23232  // advance iterator to next (non-skipped) data point:
23233  if (!doScatterSkip)
23234  ++it;
23235  else
23236  {
23237  itIndex += scatterModulo;
23238  if (itIndex < endIndex) // make sure we didn't jump over end
23239  it += scatterModulo;
23240  else
23241  {
23242  it = end;
23243  itIndex = endIndex;
23244  }
23245  }
23246  }
23247  }
23248 }
23249 
23269 int QCPCurve::getRegion(double key, double value, double keyMin, double valueMax, double keyMax, double valueMin) const
23270 {
23271  if (key < keyMin) // region 123
23272  {
23273  if (value > valueMax)
23274  return 1;
23275  else if (value < valueMin)
23276  return 3;
23277  else
23278  return 2;
23279  } else if (key > keyMax) // region 789
23280  {
23281  if (value > valueMax)
23282  return 7;
23283  else if (value < valueMin)
23284  return 9;
23285  else
23286  return 8;
23287  } else // region 456
23288  {
23289  if (value > valueMax)
23290  return 4;
23291  else if (value < valueMin)
23292  return 6;
23293  else
23294  return 5;
23295  }
23296 }
23297 
23313 QPointF QCPCurve::getOptimizedPoint(int otherRegion, double otherKey, double otherValue, double key, double value, double keyMin, double valueMax, double keyMax, double valueMin) const
23314 {
23315  // The intersection point interpolation here is done in pixel coordinates, so we don't need to
23316  // differentiate between different axis scale types. Note that the nomenclature
23317  // top/left/bottom/right/min/max is with respect to the rect in plot coordinates, wich may be
23318  // different in pixel coordinates (horz/vert key axes, reversed ranges)
23319 
23320  const double keyMinPx = mKeyAxis->coordToPixel(keyMin);
23321  const double keyMaxPx = mKeyAxis->coordToPixel(keyMax);
23322  const double valueMinPx = mValueAxis->coordToPixel(valueMin);
23323  const double valueMaxPx = mValueAxis->coordToPixel(valueMax);
23324  const double otherValuePx = mValueAxis->coordToPixel(otherValue);
23325  const double valuePx = mValueAxis->coordToPixel(value);
23326  const double otherKeyPx = mKeyAxis->coordToPixel(otherKey);
23327  const double keyPx = mKeyAxis->coordToPixel(key);
23328  double intersectKeyPx = keyMinPx; // initial key just a fail-safe
23329  double intersectValuePx = valueMinPx; // initial value just a fail-safe
23330  switch (otherRegion)
23331  {
23332  case 1: // top and left edge
23333  {
23334  intersectValuePx = valueMaxPx;
23335  intersectKeyPx = otherKeyPx + (keyPx-otherKeyPx)/(valuePx-otherValuePx)*(intersectValuePx-otherValuePx);
23336  if (intersectKeyPx < qMin(keyMinPx, keyMaxPx) || intersectKeyPx > qMax(keyMinPx, keyMaxPx)) // check whether top edge is not intersected, then it must be left edge (qMin/qMax necessary since axes may be reversed)
23337  {
23338  intersectKeyPx = keyMinPx;
23339  intersectValuePx = otherValuePx + (valuePx-otherValuePx)/(keyPx-otherKeyPx)*(intersectKeyPx-otherKeyPx);
23340  }
23341  break;
23342  }
23343  case 2: // left edge
23344  {
23345  intersectKeyPx = keyMinPx;
23346  intersectValuePx = otherValuePx + (valuePx-otherValuePx)/(keyPx-otherKeyPx)*(intersectKeyPx-otherKeyPx);
23347  break;
23348  }
23349  case 3: // bottom and left edge
23350  {
23351  intersectValuePx = valueMinPx;
23352  intersectKeyPx = otherKeyPx + (keyPx-otherKeyPx)/(valuePx-otherValuePx)*(intersectValuePx-otherValuePx);
23353  if (intersectKeyPx < qMin(keyMinPx, keyMaxPx) || intersectKeyPx > qMax(keyMinPx, keyMaxPx)) // check whether bottom edge is not intersected, then it must be left edge (qMin/qMax necessary since axes may be reversed)
23354  {
23355  intersectKeyPx = keyMinPx;
23356  intersectValuePx = otherValuePx + (valuePx-otherValuePx)/(keyPx-otherKeyPx)*(intersectKeyPx-otherKeyPx);
23357  }
23358  break;
23359  }
23360  case 4: // top edge
23361  {
23362  intersectValuePx = valueMaxPx;
23363  intersectKeyPx = otherKeyPx + (keyPx-otherKeyPx)/(valuePx-otherValuePx)*(intersectValuePx-otherValuePx);
23364  break;
23365  }
23366  case 5:
23367  {
23368  break; // case 5 shouldn't happen for this function but we add it anyway to prevent potential discontinuity in branch table
23369  }
23370  case 6: // bottom edge
23371  {
23372  intersectValuePx = valueMinPx;
23373  intersectKeyPx = otherKeyPx + (keyPx-otherKeyPx)/(valuePx-otherValuePx)*(intersectValuePx-otherValuePx);
23374  break;
23375  }
23376  case 7: // top and right edge
23377  {
23378  intersectValuePx = valueMaxPx;
23379  intersectKeyPx = otherKeyPx + (keyPx-otherKeyPx)/(valuePx-otherValuePx)*(intersectValuePx-otherValuePx);
23380  if (intersectKeyPx < qMin(keyMinPx, keyMaxPx) || intersectKeyPx > qMax(keyMinPx, keyMaxPx)) // check whether top edge is not intersected, then it must be right edge (qMin/qMax necessary since axes may be reversed)
23381  {
23382  intersectKeyPx = keyMaxPx;
23383  intersectValuePx = otherValuePx + (valuePx-otherValuePx)/(keyPx-otherKeyPx)*(intersectKeyPx-otherKeyPx);
23384  }
23385  break;
23386  }
23387  case 8: // right edge
23388  {
23389  intersectKeyPx = keyMaxPx;
23390  intersectValuePx = otherValuePx + (valuePx-otherValuePx)/(keyPx-otherKeyPx)*(intersectKeyPx-otherKeyPx);
23391  break;
23392  }
23393  case 9: // bottom and right edge
23394  {
23395  intersectValuePx = valueMinPx;
23396  intersectKeyPx = otherKeyPx + (keyPx-otherKeyPx)/(valuePx-otherValuePx)*(intersectValuePx-otherValuePx);
23397  if (intersectKeyPx < qMin(keyMinPx, keyMaxPx) || intersectKeyPx > qMax(keyMinPx, keyMaxPx)) // check whether bottom edge is not intersected, then it must be right edge (qMin/qMax necessary since axes may be reversed)
23398  {
23399  intersectKeyPx = keyMaxPx;
23400  intersectValuePx = otherValuePx + (valuePx-otherValuePx)/(keyPx-otherKeyPx)*(intersectKeyPx-otherKeyPx);
23401  }
23402  break;
23403  }
23404  }
23405  if (mKeyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Horizontal)
23406  return {intersectKeyPx, intersectValuePx};
23407  else
23408  return {intersectValuePx, intersectKeyPx};
23409 }
23410 
23429 QVector<QPointF> QCPCurve::getOptimizedCornerPoints(int prevRegion, int currentRegion, double prevKey, double prevValue, double key, double value, double keyMin, double valueMax, double keyMax, double valueMin) const
23430 {
23431  QVector<QPointF> result;
23432  switch (prevRegion)
23433  {
23434  case 1:
23435  {
23436  switch (currentRegion)
23437  {
23438  case 2: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMax); break; }
23439  case 4: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMax); break; }
23440  case 3: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMax) << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMin); break; }
23441  case 7: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMax) << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMax); break; }
23442  case 6: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMax) << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMin); result.append(result.last()); break; }
23443  case 8: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMax) << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMax); result.append(result.last()); break; }
23444  case 9: { // in this case we need another distinction of cases: segment may pass below or above rect, requiring either bottom right or top left corner points
23445  if ((value-prevValue)/(key-prevKey)*(keyMin-key)+value < valueMin) // segment passes below R
23446  { result << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMax) << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMin); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMin); }
23447  else
23448  { result << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMax) << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMax); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMin); }
23449  break;
23450  }
23451  }
23452  break;
23453  }
23454  case 2:
23455  {
23456  switch (currentRegion)
23457  {
23458  case 1: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMax); break; }
23459  case 3: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMin); break; }
23460  case 4: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMax); result.append(result.last()); break; }
23461  case 6: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMin); result.append(result.last()); break; }
23462  case 7: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMax); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMax); break; }
23463  case 9: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMin); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMin); break; }
23464  }
23465  break;
23466  }
23467  case 3:
23468  {
23469  switch (currentRegion)
23470  {
23471  case 2: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMin); break; }
23472  case 6: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMin); break; }
23473  case 1: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMin) << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMax); break; }
23474  case 9: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMin) << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMin); break; }
23475  case 4: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMin) << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMax); result.append(result.last()); break; }
23476  case 8: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMin) << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMin); result.append(result.last()); break; }
23477  case 7: { // in this case we need another distinction of cases: segment may pass below or above rect, requiring either bottom right or top left corner points
23478  if ((value-prevValue)/(key-prevKey)*(keyMax-key)+value < valueMin) // segment passes below R
23479  { result << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMin) << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMin); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMax); }
23480  else
23481  { result << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMin) << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMax); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMax); }
23482  break;
23483  }
23484  }
23485  break;
23486  }
23487  case 4:
23488  {
23489  switch (currentRegion)
23490  {
23491  case 1: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMax); break; }
23492  case 7: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMax); break; }
23493  case 2: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMax); result.append(result.last()); break; }
23494  case 8: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMax); result.append(result.last()); break; }
23495  case 3: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMax); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMin); break; }
23496  case 9: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMax); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMin); break; }
23497  }
23498  break;
23499  }
23500  case 5:
23501  {
23502  switch (currentRegion)
23503  {
23504  case 1: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMax); break; }
23505  case 7: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMax); break; }
23506  case 9: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMin); break; }
23507  case 3: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMin); break; }
23508  }
23509  break;
23510  }
23511  case 6:
23512  {
23513  switch (currentRegion)
23514  {
23515  case 3: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMin); break; }
23516  case 9: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMin); break; }
23517  case 2: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMin); result.append(result.last()); break; }
23518  case 8: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMin); result.append(result.last()); break; }
23519  case 1: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMin); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMax); break; }
23520  case 7: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMin); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMax); break; }
23521  }
23522  break;
23523  }
23524  case 7:
23525  {
23526  switch (currentRegion)
23527  {
23528  case 4: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMax); break; }
23529  case 8: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMax); break; }
23530  case 1: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMax) << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMax); break; }
23531  case 9: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMax) << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMin); break; }
23532  case 2: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMax) << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMax); result.append(result.last()); break; }
23533  case 6: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMax) << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMin); result.append(result.last()); break; }
23534  case 3: { // in this case we need another distinction of cases: segment may pass below or above rect, requiring either bottom right or top left corner points
23535  if ((value-prevValue)/(key-prevKey)*(keyMax-key)+value < valueMin) // segment passes below R
23536  { result << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMax) << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMin); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMin); }
23537  else
23538  { result << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMax) << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMax); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMin); }
23539  break;
23540  }
23541  }
23542  break;
23543  }
23544  case 8:
23545  {
23546  switch (currentRegion)
23547  {
23548  case 7: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMax); break; }
23549  case 9: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMin); break; }
23550  case 4: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMax); result.append(result.last()); break; }
23551  case 6: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMin); result.append(result.last()); break; }
23552  case 1: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMax); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMax); break; }
23553  case 3: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMin); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMin); break; }
23554  }
23555  break;
23556  }
23557  case 9:
23558  {
23559  switch (currentRegion)
23560  {
23561  case 6: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMin); break; }
23562  case 8: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMin); break; }
23563  case 3: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMin) << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMin); break; }
23564  case 7: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMin) << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMax); break; }
23565  case 2: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMin) << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMin); result.append(result.last()); break; }
23566  case 4: { result << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMin) << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMax); result.append(result.last()); break; }
23567  case 1: { // in this case we need another distinction of cases: segment may pass below or above rect, requiring either bottom right or top left corner points
23568  if ((value-prevValue)/(key-prevKey)*(keyMin-key)+value < valueMin) // segment passes below R
23569  { result << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMin) << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMin); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMax); }
23570  else
23571  { result << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMin) << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMax); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMax); }
23572  break;
23573  }
23574  }
23575  break;
23576  }
23577  }
23578  return result;
23579 }
23580 
23593 bool QCPCurve::mayTraverse(int prevRegion, int currentRegion) const
23594 {
23595  switch (prevRegion)
23596  {
23597  case 1:
23598  {
23599  switch (currentRegion)
23600  {
23601  case 4:
23602  case 7:
23603  case 2:
23604  case 3: return false;
23605  default: return true;
23606  }
23607  }
23608  case 2:
23609  {
23610  switch (currentRegion)
23611  {
23612  case 1:
23613  case 3: return false;
23614  default: return true;
23615  }
23616  }
23617  case 3:
23618  {
23619  switch (currentRegion)
23620  {
23621  case 1:
23622  case 2:
23623  case 6:
23624  case 9: return false;
23625  default: return true;
23626  }
23627  }
23628  case 4:
23629  {
23630  switch (currentRegion)
23631  {
23632  case 1:
23633  case 7: return false;
23634  default: return true;
23635  }
23636  }
23637  case 5: return false; // should never occur
23638  case 6:
23639  {
23640  switch (currentRegion)
23641  {
23642  case 3:
23643  case 9: return false;
23644  default: return true;
23645  }
23646  }
23647  case 7:
23648  {
23649  switch (currentRegion)
23650  {
23651  case 1:
23652  case 4:
23653  case 8:
23654  case 9: return false;
23655  default: return true;
23656  }
23657  }
23658  case 8:
23659  {
23660  switch (currentRegion)
23661  {
23662  case 7:
23663  case 9: return false;
23664  default: return true;
23665  }
23666  }
23667  case 9:
23668  {
23669  switch (currentRegion)
23670  {
23671  case 3:
23672  case 6:
23673  case 8:
23674  case 7: return false;
23675  default: return true;
23676  }
23677  }
23678  default: return true;
23679  }
23680 }
23681 
23682 
23696 bool QCPCurve::getTraverse(double prevKey, double prevValue, double key, double value, double keyMin, double valueMax, double keyMax, double valueMin, QPointF &crossA, QPointF &crossB) const
23697 {
23698  // The intersection point interpolation here is done in pixel coordinates, so we don't need to
23699  // differentiate between different axis scale types. Note that the nomenclature
23700  // top/left/bottom/right/min/max is with respect to the rect in plot coordinates, wich may be
23701  // different in pixel coordinates (horz/vert key axes, reversed ranges)
23702 
23703  QList<QPointF> intersections;
23704  const double valueMinPx = mValueAxis->coordToPixel(valueMin);
23705  const double valueMaxPx = mValueAxis->coordToPixel(valueMax);
23706  const double keyMinPx = mKeyAxis->coordToPixel(keyMin);
23707  const double keyMaxPx = mKeyAxis->coordToPixel(keyMax);
23708  const double keyPx = mKeyAxis->coordToPixel(key);
23709  const double valuePx = mValueAxis->coordToPixel(value);
23710  const double prevKeyPx = mKeyAxis->coordToPixel(prevKey);
23711  const double prevValuePx = mValueAxis->coordToPixel(prevValue);
23712  if (qFuzzyIsNull(keyPx-prevKeyPx)) // line is parallel to value axis
23713  {
23714  // due to region filter in mayTraverse(), if line is parallel to value or key axis, region 5 is traversed here
23715  intersections.append(mKeyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Horizontal ? QPointF(keyPx, valueMinPx) : QPointF(valueMinPx, keyPx)); // direction will be taken care of at end of method
23716  intersections.append(mKeyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Horizontal ? QPointF(keyPx, valueMaxPx) : QPointF(valueMaxPx, keyPx));
23717  } else if (qFuzzyIsNull(valuePx-prevValuePx)) // line is parallel to key axis
23718  {
23719  // due to region filter in mayTraverse(), if line is parallel to value or key axis, region 5 is traversed here
23720  intersections.append(mKeyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Horizontal ? QPointF(keyMinPx, valuePx) : QPointF(valuePx, keyMinPx)); // direction will be taken care of at end of method
23721  intersections.append(mKeyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Horizontal ? QPointF(keyMaxPx, valuePx) : QPointF(valuePx, keyMaxPx));
23722  } else // line is skewed
23723  {
23724  double gamma;
23725  double keyPerValuePx = (keyPx-prevKeyPx)/(valuePx-prevValuePx);
23726  // check top of rect:
23727  gamma = prevKeyPx + (valueMaxPx-prevValuePx)*keyPerValuePx;
23728  if (gamma >= qMin(keyMinPx, keyMaxPx) && gamma <= qMax(keyMinPx, keyMaxPx)) // qMin/qMax necessary since axes may be reversed
23729  intersections.append(mKeyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Horizontal ? QPointF(gamma, valueMaxPx) : QPointF(valueMaxPx, gamma));
23730  // check bottom of rect:
23731  gamma = prevKeyPx + (valueMinPx-prevValuePx)*keyPerValuePx;
23732  if (gamma >= qMin(keyMinPx, keyMaxPx) && gamma <= qMax(keyMinPx, keyMaxPx)) // qMin/qMax necessary since axes may be reversed
23733  intersections.append(mKeyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Horizontal ? QPointF(gamma, valueMinPx) : QPointF(valueMinPx, gamma));
23734  const double valuePerKeyPx = 1.0/keyPerValuePx;
23735  // check left of rect:
23736  gamma = prevValuePx + (keyMinPx-prevKeyPx)*valuePerKeyPx;
23737  if (gamma >= qMin(valueMinPx, valueMaxPx) && gamma <= qMax(valueMinPx, valueMaxPx)) // qMin/qMax necessary since axes may be reversed
23738  intersections.append(mKeyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Horizontal ? QPointF(keyMinPx, gamma) : QPointF(gamma, keyMinPx));
23739  // check right of rect:
23740  gamma = prevValuePx + (keyMaxPx-prevKeyPx)*valuePerKeyPx;
23741  if (gamma >= qMin(valueMinPx, valueMaxPx) && gamma <= qMax(valueMinPx, valueMaxPx)) // qMin/qMax necessary since axes may be reversed
23742  intersections.append(mKeyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Horizontal ? QPointF(keyMaxPx, gamma) : QPointF(gamma, keyMaxPx));
23743  }
23744 
23745  // handle cases where found points isn't exactly 2:
23746  if (intersections.size() > 2)
23747  {
23748  // line probably goes through corner of rect, and we got duplicate points there. single out the point pair with greatest distance in between:
23749  double distSqrMax = 0;
23750  QPointF pv1, pv2;
23751  for (int i=0; i<intersections.size()-1; ++i)
23752  {
23753  for (int k=i+1; k<intersections.size(); ++k)
23754  {
23755  QPointF distPoint = intersections.at(i)-intersections.at(k);
23756  double distSqr = distPoint.x()*distPoint.x()+distPoint.y()+distPoint.y();
23757  if (distSqr > distSqrMax)
23758  {
23759  pv1 = intersections.at(i);
23760  pv2 = intersections.at(k);
23761  distSqrMax = distSqr;
23762  }
23763  }
23764  }
23765  intersections = QList<QPointF>() << pv1 << pv2;
23766  } else if (intersections.size() != 2)
23767  {
23768  // one or even zero points found (shouldn't happen unless line perfectly tangent to corner), no need to draw segment
23769  return false;
23770  }
23771 
23772  // possibly re-sort points so optimized point segment has same direction as original segment:
23773  double xDelta = keyPx-prevKeyPx;
23774  double yDelta = valuePx-prevValuePx;
23775  if (mKeyAxis->orientation() != Qt::Horizontal)
23776  qSwap(xDelta, yDelta);
23777  if (xDelta*(intersections.at(1).x()-intersections.at(0).x()) + yDelta*(intersections.at(1).y()-intersections.at(0).y()) < 0) // scalar product of both segments < 0 -> opposite direction
23778  intersections.move(0, 1);
23779  crossA = intersections.at(0);
23780  crossB = intersections.at(1);
23781  return true;
23782 }
23783 
23809 void QCPCurve::getTraverseCornerPoints(int prevRegion, int currentRegion, double keyMin, double valueMax, double keyMax, double valueMin, QVector<QPointF> &beforeTraverse, QVector<QPointF> &afterTraverse) const
23810 {
23811  switch (prevRegion)
23812  {
23813  case 1:
23814  {
23815  switch (currentRegion)
23816  {
23817  case 6: { beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMax); break; }
23818  case 9: { beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMax); afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMin); break; }
23819  case 8: { beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMax); break; }
23820  }
23821  break;
23822  }
23823  case 2:
23824  {
23825  switch (currentRegion)
23826  {
23827  case 7: { afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMax); break; }
23828  case 9: { afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMin); break; }
23829  }
23830  break;
23831  }
23832  case 3:
23833  {
23834  switch (currentRegion)
23835  {
23836  case 4: { beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMin); break; }
23837  case 7: { beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMin); afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMax); break; }
23838  case 8: { beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMin); break; }
23839  }
23840  break;
23841  }
23842  case 4:
23843  {
23844  switch (currentRegion)
23845  {
23846  case 3: { afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMin); break; }
23847  case 9: { afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMin); break; }
23848  }
23849  break;
23850  }
23851  case 5: { break; } // shouldn't happen because this method only handles full traverses
23852  case 6:
23853  {
23854  switch (currentRegion)
23855  {
23856  case 1: { afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMax); break; }
23857  case 7: { afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMax); break; }
23858  }
23859  break;
23860  }
23861  case 7:
23862  {
23863  switch (currentRegion)
23864  {
23865  case 2: { beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMax); break; }
23866  case 3: { beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMax); afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMin); break; }
23867  case 6: { beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMax); break; }
23868  }
23869  break;
23870  }
23871  case 8:
23872  {
23873  switch (currentRegion)
23874  {
23875  case 1: { afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMax); break; }
23876  case 3: { afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMin); break; }
23877  }
23878  break;
23879  }
23880  case 9:
23881  {
23882  switch (currentRegion)
23883  {
23884  case 2: { beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMin); break; }
23885  case 1: { beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMin); afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(keyMin, valueMax); break; }
23886  case 4: { beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(keyMax, valueMin); break; }
23887  }
23888  break;
23889  }
23890  }
23891 }
23892 
23905 double QCPCurve::pointDistance(const QPointF &pixelPoint, QCPCurveDataContainer::const_iterator &closestData) const
23906 {
23907  closestData = mDataContainer->constEnd();
23908  if (mDataContainer->isEmpty())
23909  return -1.0;
23910  if (mLineStyle == lsNone && mScatterStyle.isNone())
23911  return -1.0;
23912 
23913  if (mDataContainer->size() == 1)
23914  {
23915  QPointF dataPoint = coordsToPixels(mDataContainer->constBegin()->key, mDataContainer->constBegin()->value);
23916  closestData = mDataContainer->constBegin();
23917  return QCPVector2D(dataPoint-pixelPoint).length();
23918  }
23919 
23920  // calculate minimum distances to curve data points and find closestData iterator:
23921  double minDistSqr = (std::numeric_limits<double>::max)();
23922  // iterate over found data points and then choose the one with the shortest distance to pos:
23923  QCPCurveDataContainer::const_iterator begin = mDataContainer->constBegin();
23924  QCPCurveDataContainer::const_iterator end = mDataContainer->constEnd();
23925  for (QCPCurveDataContainer::const_iterator it=begin; it!=end; ++it)
23926  {
23927  const double currentDistSqr = QCPVector2D(coordsToPixels(it->key, it->value)-pixelPoint).lengthSquared();
23928  if (currentDistSqr < minDistSqr)
23929  {
23930  minDistSqr = currentDistSqr;
23931  closestData = it;
23932  }
23933  }
23934 
23935  // calculate distance to line if there is one (if so, will probably be smaller than distance to closest data point):
23936  if (mLineStyle != lsNone)
23937  {
23938  QVector<QPointF> lines;
23939  getCurveLines(&lines, QCPDataRange(0, dataCount()), mParentPlot->selectionTolerance()*1.2); // optimized lines outside axis rect shouldn't respond to clicks at the edge, so use 1.2*tolerance as pen width
23940  for (int i=0; i<lines.size()-1; ++i)
23941  {
23942  double currentDistSqr = QCPVector2D(pixelPoint).distanceSquaredToLine(lines.at(i), lines.at(i+1));
23943  if (currentDistSqr < minDistSqr)
23944  minDistSqr = currentDistSqr;
23945  }
23946  }
23947 
23948  return qSqrt(minDistSqr);
23949 }
23950 /* end of 'src/plottables/plottable-curve.cpp' */
23951 
23952 
23953 /* including file 'src/plottables/plottable-bars.cpp' */
23954 /* modified 2022-11-06T12:45:56, size 43907 */
23955

24028 QCPBarsGroup::QCPBarsGroup(QCustomPlot *parentPlot) :
24029  QObject(parentPlot),
24030  mParentPlot(parentPlot),
24031  mSpacingType(stAbsolute),
24032  mSpacing(4)
24033 {
24034 }

24036 QCPBarsGroup::~QCPBarsGroup()
24037 {
24038  clear();
24039 }

24048 void QCPBarsGroup::setSpacingType(SpacingType spacingType)

24051 }

24059 void QCPBarsGroup::setSpacing(double spacing)
24060 {
24061  mSpacing = spacing;
24062 }
24063 
24070 QCPBars *QCPBarsGroup::bars(int index) const
24071 {
24072  if (index >= 0 && index < mBars.size())
24073  {
24074  return mBars.at(index);
24075  } else
24076  {
24077  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "index out of bounds:" << index;
24078  return nullptr;
24079  }
24080 }
24081 
24087 void QCPBarsGroup::clear()
24088 {
24089  const QList<QCPBars*> oldBars = mBars;
24090  foreach (QCPBars *bars, oldBars)
24091  bars->setBarsGroup(nullptr); // removes itself from mBars via removeBars
24092 }
24093 
24100 void QCPBarsGroup::append(QCPBars *bars)
24101 {
24102  if (!bars)
24103  {
24104  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "bars is 0";
24105  return;
24106  }
24107 
24108  if (!mBars.contains(bars))
24109  bars->setBarsGroup(this);
24110  else
24111  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "bars plottable is already in this bars group:" << reinterpret_cast<quintptr>(bars);
24112 }
24113 
24123 void QCPBarsGroup::insert(int i, QCPBars *bars)
24124 {
24125  if (!bars)
24126  {
24127  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "bars is 0";
24128  return;
24129  }
24130 
24131  // first append to bars list normally:
24132  if (!mBars.contains(bars))
24133  bars->setBarsGroup(this);
24134  // then move to according position:
24135  mBars.move(mBars.indexOf(bars), qBound(0, i, mBars.size()-1));
24136 }
24137 
24143 void QCPBarsGroup::remove(QCPBars *bars)
24144 {
24145  if (!bars)
24146  {
24147  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "bars is 0";
24148  return;
24149  }
24150 
24151  if (mBars.contains(bars))
24152  bars->setBarsGroup(nullptr);
24153  else
24154  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "bars plottable is not in this bars group:" << reinterpret_cast<quintptr>(bars);
24155 }
24156 
24164 void QCPBarsGroup::registerBars(QCPBars *bars)
24165 {
24166  if (!mBars.contains(bars))
24167  mBars.append(bars);
24168 }
24169 
24177 void QCPBarsGroup::unregisterBars(QCPBars *bars)
24178 {
24179  mBars.removeOne(bars);
24180 }
24181 
24188 double QCPBarsGroup::keyPixelOffset(const QCPBars *bars, double keyCoord)
24189 {
24190  // find list of all base bars in case some mBars are stacked:
24191  QList<const QCPBars*> baseBars;
24192  foreach (const QCPBars *b, mBars)
24193  {
24194  while (b->barBelow())
24195  b = b->barBelow();
24196  if (!baseBars.contains(b))
24197  baseBars.append(b);
24198  }
24199  // find base bar this "bars" is stacked on:
24200  const QCPBars *thisBase = bars;
24201  while (thisBase->barBelow())
24202  thisBase = thisBase->barBelow();
24203 
24204  // determine key pixel offset of this base bars considering all other base bars in this barsgroup:
24205  double result = 0;
24206  int index = baseBars.indexOf(thisBase);
24207  if (index >= 0)
24208  {
24209  if (baseBars.size() % 2 == 1 && index == (baseBars.size()-1)/2) // is center bar (int division on purpose)
24210  {
24211  return result;
24212  } else
24213  {
24214  double lowerPixelWidth, upperPixelWidth;
24215  int startIndex;
24216  int dir = (index <= (baseBars.size()-1)/2) ? -1 : 1; // if bar is to lower keys of center, dir is negative
24217  if (baseBars.size() % 2 == 0) // even number of bars
24218  {
24219  startIndex = baseBars.size()/2 + (dir < 0 ? -1 : 0);
24220  result += getPixelSpacing(baseBars.at(startIndex), keyCoord)*0.5; // half of middle spacing
24221  } else // uneven number of bars
24222  {
24223  startIndex = (baseBars.size()-1)/2+dir;
24224  baseBars.at((baseBars.size()-1)/2)->getPixelWidth(keyCoord, lowerPixelWidth, upperPixelWidth);
24225  result += qAbs(upperPixelWidth-lowerPixelWidth)*0.5; // half of center bar
24226  result += getPixelSpacing(baseBars.at((baseBars.size()-1)/2), keyCoord); // center bar spacing
24227  }
24228  for (int i = startIndex; i != index; i += dir) // add widths and spacings of bars in between center and our bars
24229  {
24230  baseBars.at(i)->getPixelWidth(keyCoord, lowerPixelWidth, upperPixelWidth);
24231  result += qAbs(upperPixelWidth-lowerPixelWidth);
24232  result += getPixelSpacing(baseBars.at(i), keyCoord);
24233  }
24234  // finally half of our bars width:
24235  baseBars.at(index)->getPixelWidth(keyCoord, lowerPixelWidth, upperPixelWidth);
24236  result += qAbs(upperPixelWidth-lowerPixelWidth)*0.5;
24237  // correct sign of result depending on orientation and direction of key axis:
24238  result *= dir*thisBase->keyAxis()->pixelOrientation();
24239  }
24240  }
24241  return result;
24242 }
24243 
24254 double QCPBarsGroup::getPixelSpacing(const QCPBars *bars, double keyCoord)
24255 {
24256  switch (mSpacingType)
24257  {
24258  case stAbsolute:
24259  {
24260  return mSpacing;
24261  }
24262  case stAxisRectRatio:
24263  {
24264  if (bars->keyAxis()->orientation() == Qt::Horizontal)
24265  return bars->keyAxis()->axisRect()->width()*mSpacing;
24266  else
24267  return bars->keyAxis()->axisRect()->height()*mSpacing;
24268  }
24269  case stPlotCoords:
24270  {
24271  double keyPixel = bars->keyAxis()->coordToPixel(keyCoord);
24272  return qAbs(bars->keyAxis()->coordToPixel(keyCoord+mSpacing)-keyPixel);
24273  }
24274  }
24275  return 0;
24276 }
24277 
24278 
24282 
24297 /* start documentation of inline functions */
24298 
24348 /* end documentation of inline functions */
24349 
24353 QCPBarsData::QCPBarsData() :
24354  key(0),
24355  value(0)
24356 {
24357 }
24358 
24362 QCPBarsData::QCPBarsData(double key, double value) :
24363  key(key),
24364  value(value)
24365 {
24366 }
24367 
24368 
24372 
24408 /* start of documentation of inline functions */
24409 
24431 /* end of documentation of inline functions */
24432 
24443 QCPBars::QCPBars(QCPAxis *keyAxis, QCPAxis *valueAxis) :
24444  QCPAbstractPlottable1D<QCPBarsData>(keyAxis, valueAxis),
24445  mWidth(0.75),
24446  mWidthType(wtPlotCoords),
24447  mBarsGroup(nullptr),
24448  mBaseValue(0),
24449  mStackingGap(1)
24450 {
24451  // modify inherited properties from abstract plottable:
24452  mPen.setColor(Qt::blue);
24453  mPen.setStyle(Qt::SolidLine);
24454  mBrush.setColor(QColor(40, 50, 255, 30));
24455  mBrush.setStyle(Qt::SolidPattern);
24456  mSelectionDecorator->setBrush(QBrush(QColor(160, 160, 255)));
24457 }
24458 
24459 QCPBars::~QCPBars()
24460 {
24461  setBarsGroup(nullptr);
24462  if (mBarBelow || mBarAbove)
24463  connectBars(mBarBelow.data(), mBarAbove.data()); // take this bar out of any stacking
24464 }
24465 
24481 void QCPBars::setData(QSharedPointer<QCPBarsDataContainer> data)
24482 {
24483  mDataContainer = data;
24484 }
24485 
24497 void QCPBars::setData(const QVector<double> &keys, const QVector<double> &values, bool alreadySorted)
24498 {
24499  mDataContainer->clear();
24500  addData(keys, values, alreadySorted);
24501 }
24502 
24509 void QCPBars::setWidth(double width)
24510 {
24511  mWidth = width;
24512 }
24513 
24522 void QCPBars::setWidthType(QCPBars::WidthType widthType)
24523 {
24524  mWidthType = widthType;
24525 }
24526 
24533 void QCPBars::setBarsGroup(QCPBarsGroup *barsGroup)
24534 {
24535  // deregister at old group:
24536  if (mBarsGroup)
24537  mBarsGroup->unregisterBars(this);
24538  mBarsGroup = barsGroup;
24539  // register at new group:
24540  if (mBarsGroup)
24541  mBarsGroup->registerBars(this);
24542 }
24543 
24556 void QCPBars::setBaseValue(double baseValue)
24557 {
24558  mBaseValue = baseValue;
24559 }
24560 
24566 void QCPBars::setStackingGap(double pixels)
24567 {
24568  mStackingGap = pixels;
24569 }
24570 
24583 void QCPBars::addData(const QVector<double> &keys, const QVector<double> &values, bool alreadySorted)
24584 {
24585  if (keys.size() != values.size())
24586  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "keys and values have different sizes:" << keys.size() << values.size();
24587  const int n = qMin(keys.size(), values.size());
24588  QVector<QCPBarsData> tempData(n);
24589  QVector<QCPBarsData>::iterator it = tempData.begin();
24590  const QVector<QCPBarsData>::iterator itEnd = tempData.end();
24591  int i = 0;
24592  while (it != itEnd)
24593  {
24594  it->key = keys[i];
24595  it->value = values[i];
24596  ++it;
24597  ++i;
24598  }
24599  mDataContainer->add(tempData, alreadySorted); // don't modify tempData beyond this to prevent copy on write
24600 }
24601 
24608 void QCPBars::addData(double key, double value)
24609 {
24610  mDataContainer->add(QCPBarsData(key, value));
24611 }
24612 
24627 void QCPBars::moveBelow(QCPBars *bars)
24628 {
24629  if (bars == this) return;
24630  if (bars && (bars->keyAxis() != mKeyAxis.data() || bars->valueAxis() != mValueAxis.data()))
24631  {
24632  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "passed QCPBars* doesn't have same key and value axis as this QCPBars";
24633  return;
24634  }
24635  // remove from stacking:
24636  connectBars(mBarBelow.data(), mBarAbove.data()); // Note: also works if one (or both) of them is 0
24637  // if new bar given, insert this bar below it:
24638  if (bars)
24639  {
24640  if (bars->mBarBelow)
24641  connectBars(bars->mBarBelow.data(), this);
24642  connectBars(this, bars);
24643  }
24644 }
24645 
24660 void QCPBars::moveAbove(QCPBars *bars)
24661 {
24662  if (bars == this) return;
24663  if (bars && (bars->keyAxis() != mKeyAxis.data() || bars->valueAxis() != mValueAxis.data()))
24664  {
24665  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "passed QCPBars* doesn't have same key and value axis as this QCPBars";
24666  return;
24667  }
24668  // remove from stacking:
24669  connectBars(mBarBelow.data(), mBarAbove.data()); // Note: also works if one (or both) of them is 0
24670  // if new bar given, insert this bar above it:
24671  if (bars)
24672  {
24673  if (bars->mBarAbove)
24674  connectBars(this, bars->mBarAbove.data());
24675  connectBars(bars, this);
24676  }
24677 }
24678 
24682 QCPDataSelection QCPBars::selectTestRect(const QRectF &rect, bool onlySelectable) const
24683 {
24684  QCPDataSelection result;
24685  if ((onlySelectable && mSelectable == QCP::stNone) || mDataContainer->isEmpty())
24686  return result;
24687  if (!mKeyAxis || !mValueAxis)
24688  return result;
24689 
24690  QCPBarsDataContainer::const_iterator visibleBegin, visibleEnd;
24691  getVisibleDataBounds(visibleBegin, visibleEnd);
24692 
24693  for (QCPBarsDataContainer::const_iterator it=visibleBegin; it!=visibleEnd; ++it)
24694  {
24695  if (rect.intersects(getBarRect(it->key, it->value)))
24696  result.addDataRange(QCPDataRange(int(it-mDataContainer->constBegin()), int(it-mDataContainer->constBegin()+1)), false);
24697  }
24698  result.simplify();
24699  return result;
24700 }
24701 
24710 double QCPBars::selectTest(const QPointF &pos, bool onlySelectable, QVariant *details) const
24711 {
24712  Q_UNUSED(details)
24713  if ((onlySelectable && mSelectable == QCP::stNone) || mDataContainer->isEmpty())
24714  return -1;
24715  if (!mKeyAxis || !mValueAxis)
24716  return -1;
24717 
24718  if (mKeyAxis.data()->axisRect()->rect().contains(pos.toPoint()) || mParentPlot->interactions().testFlag(QCP::iSelectPlottablesBeyondAxisRect))
24719  {
24720  // get visible data range:
24721  QCPBarsDataContainer::const_iterator visibleBegin, visibleEnd;
24722  getVisibleDataBounds(visibleBegin, visibleEnd);
24723  for (QCPBarsDataContainer::const_iterator it=visibleBegin; it!=visibleEnd; ++it)
24724  {
24725  if (getBarRect(it->key, it->value).contains(pos))
24726  {
24727  if (details)
24728  {
24729  int pointIndex = int(it-mDataContainer->constBegin());
24730  details->setValue(QCPDataSelection(QCPDataRange(pointIndex, pointIndex+1)));
24731  }
24732  return mParentPlot->selectionTolerance()*0.99;
24733  }
24734  }
24735  }
24736  return -1;
24737 }
24738 
24739 /* inherits documentation from base class */
24740 QCPRange QCPBars::getKeyRange(bool &foundRange, QCP::SignDomain inSignDomain) const
24741 {
24742  /* Note: If this QCPBars uses absolute pixels as width (or is in a QCPBarsGroup with spacing in
24743  absolute pixels), using this method to adapt the key axis range to fit the bars into the
24744  currently visible axis range will not work perfectly. Because in the moment the axis range is
24745  changed to the new range, the fixed pixel widths/spacings will represent different coordinate
24746  spans than before, which in turn would require a different key range to perfectly fit, and so on.
24747  The only solution would be to iteratively approach the perfect fitting axis range, but the
24748  mismatch isn't large enough in most applications, to warrant this here. If a user does need a
24749  better fit, he should call the corresponding axis rescale multiple times in a row.
24750  */
24751  QCPRange range;
24752  range = mDataContainer->keyRange(foundRange, inSignDomain);
24753 
24754  // determine exact range of bars by including bar width and barsgroup offset:
24755  if (foundRange && mKeyAxis)
24756  {
24757  double lowerPixelWidth, upperPixelWidth, keyPixel;
24758  // lower range bound:
24759  getPixelWidth(range.lower, lowerPixelWidth, upperPixelWidth);
24760  keyPixel = mKeyAxis.data()->coordToPixel(range.lower) + lowerPixelWidth;
24761  if (mBarsGroup)
24762  keyPixel += mBarsGroup->keyPixelOffset(this, range.lower);
24763  const double lowerCorrected = mKeyAxis.data()->pixelToCoord(keyPixel);
24764  if (!qIsNaN(lowerCorrected) && qIsFinite(lowerCorrected) && range.lower > lowerCorrected)
24765  range.lower = lowerCorrected;
24766  // upper range bound:
24767  getPixelWidth(range.upper, lowerPixelWidth, upperPixelWidth);
24768  keyPixel = mKeyAxis.data()->coordToPixel(range.upper) + upperPixelWidth;
24769  if (mBarsGroup)
24770  keyPixel += mBarsGroup->keyPixelOffset(this, range.upper);
24771  const double upperCorrected = mKeyAxis.data()->pixelToCoord(keyPixel);
24772  if (!qIsNaN(upperCorrected) && qIsFinite(upperCorrected) && range.upper < upperCorrected)
24773  range.upper = upperCorrected;
24774  }
24775  return range;
24776 }
24777 
24778 /* inherits documentation from base class */
24779 QCPRange QCPBars::getValueRange(bool &foundRange, QCP::SignDomain inSignDomain, const QCPRange &inKeyRange) const
24780 {
24781  // Note: can't simply use mDataContainer->valueRange here because we need to
24782  // take into account bar base value and possible stacking of multiple bars
24783  QCPRange range;
24784  range.lower = mBaseValue;
24785  range.upper = mBaseValue;
24786  bool haveLower = true; // set to true, because baseValue should always be visible in bar charts
24787  bool haveUpper = true; // set to true, because baseValue should always be visible in bar charts
24788  QCPBarsDataContainer::const_iterator itBegin = mDataContainer->constBegin();
24789  QCPBarsDataContainer::const_iterator itEnd = mDataContainer->constEnd();
24790  if (inKeyRange != QCPRange())
24791  {
24792  itBegin = mDataContainer->findBegin(inKeyRange.lower, false);
24793  itEnd = mDataContainer->findEnd(inKeyRange.upper, false);
24794  }
24795  for (QCPBarsDataContainer::const_iterator it = itBegin; it != itEnd; ++it)
24796  {
24797  const double current = it->value + getStackedBaseValue(it->key, it->value >= 0);
24798  if (qIsNaN(current)) continue;
24799  if (inSignDomain == QCP::sdBoth || (inSignDomain == QCP::sdNegative && current < 0) || (inSignDomain == QCP::sdPositive && current > 0))
24800  {
24801  if (current < range.lower || !haveLower)
24802  {
24803  range.lower = current;
24804  haveLower = true;
24805  }
24806  if (current > range.upper || !haveUpper)
24807  {
24808  range.upper = current;
24809  haveUpper = true;
24810  }
24811  }
24812  }
24813 
24814  foundRange = true; // return true because bar charts always have the 0-line visible
24815  return range;
24816 }
24817 
24818 /* inherits documentation from base class */
24819 QPointF QCPBars::dataPixelPosition(int index) const
24820 {
24821  if (index >= 0 && index < mDataContainer->size())
24822  {
24823  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
24824  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
24825  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return {}; }
24826 
24827  const QCPDataContainer<QCPBarsData>::const_iterator it = mDataContainer->constBegin()+index;
24828  const double valuePixel = valueAxis->coordToPixel(getStackedBaseValue(it->key, it->value >= 0) + it->value);
24829  const double keyPixel = keyAxis->coordToPixel(it->key) + (mBarsGroup ? mBarsGroup->keyPixelOffset(this, it->key) : 0);
24830  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Horizontal)
24831  return {keyPixel, valuePixel};
24832  else
24833  return {valuePixel, keyPixel};
24834  } else
24835  {
24836  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "Index out of bounds" << index;
24837  return {};
24838  }
24839 }
24840 
24841 /* inherits documentation from base class */
24842 void QCPBars::draw(QCPPainter *painter)
24843 {
24844  if (!mKeyAxis || !mValueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return; }
24845  if (mDataContainer->isEmpty()) return;
24846 
24847  QCPBarsDataContainer::const_iterator visibleBegin, visibleEnd;
24848  getVisibleDataBounds(visibleBegin, visibleEnd);
24849 
24850  // loop over and draw segments of unselected/selected data:
24851  QList<QCPDataRange> selectedSegments, unselectedSegments, allSegments;
24852  getDataSegments(selectedSegments, unselectedSegments);
24853  allSegments << unselectedSegments << selectedSegments;
24854  for (int i=0; i<allSegments.size(); ++i)
24855  {
24856  bool isSelectedSegment = i >= unselectedSegments.size();
24857  QCPBarsDataContainer::const_iterator begin = visibleBegin;
24858  QCPBarsDataContainer::const_iterator end = visibleEnd;
24859  mDataContainer->limitIteratorsToDataRange(begin, end, allSegments.at(i));
24860  if (begin == end)
24861  continue;
24862 
24863  for (QCPBarsDataContainer::const_iterator it=begin; it!=end; ++it)
24864  {
24865  // check data validity if flag set:
24866 #ifdef QCUSTOMPLOT_CHECK_DATA
24867  if (QCP::isInvalidData(it->key, it->value))
24868  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "Data point at" << it->key << "of drawn range invalid." << "Plottable name:" << name();
24869 #endif
24870  // draw bar:
24871  if (isSelectedSegment && mSelectionDecorator)
24872  {
24873  mSelectionDecorator->applyBrush(painter);
24874  mSelectionDecorator->applyPen(painter);
24875  } else
24876  {
24877  painter->setBrush(mBrush);
24878  painter->setPen(mPen);
24879  }
24880  applyDefaultAntialiasingHint(painter);
24881  painter->drawPolygon(getBarRect(it->key, it->value));
24882  }
24883  }
24884 
24885  // draw other selection decoration that isn't just line/scatter pens and brushes:
24886  if (mSelectionDecorator)
24887  mSelectionDecorator->drawDecoration(painter, selection());
24888 }
24889 
24890 /* inherits documentation from base class */
24891 void QCPBars::drawLegendIcon(QCPPainter *painter, const QRectF &rect) const
24892 {
24893  // draw filled rect:
24894  applyDefaultAntialiasingHint(painter);
24895  painter->setBrush(mBrush);
24896  painter->setPen(mPen);
24897  QRectF r = QRectF(0, 0, rect.width()*0.67, rect.height()*0.67);
24898  r.moveCenter(rect.center());
24899  painter->drawRect(r);
24900 }
24901 
24916 void QCPBars::getVisibleDataBounds(QCPBarsDataContainer::const_iterator &begin, QCPBarsDataContainer::const_iterator &end) const
24917 {
24918  if (!mKeyAxis)
24919  {
24920  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key axis";
24921  begin = mDataContainer->constEnd();
24922  end = mDataContainer->constEnd();
24923  return;
24924  }
24925  if (mDataContainer->isEmpty())
24926  {
24927  begin = mDataContainer->constEnd();
24928  end = mDataContainer->constEnd();
24929  return;
24930  }
24931 
24932  // get visible data range as QMap iterators
24933  begin = mDataContainer->findBegin(mKeyAxis.data()->range().lower);
24934  end = mDataContainer->findEnd(mKeyAxis.data()->range().upper);
24935  double lowerPixelBound = mKeyAxis.data()->coordToPixel(mKeyAxis.data()->range().lower);
24936  double upperPixelBound = mKeyAxis.data()->coordToPixel(mKeyAxis.data()->range().upper);
24937  bool isVisible = false;
24938  // walk left from begin to find lower bar that actually is completely outside visible pixel range:
24939  QCPBarsDataContainer::const_iterator it = begin;
24940  while (it != mDataContainer->constBegin())
24941  {
24942  --it;
24943  const QRectF barRect = getBarRect(it->key, it->value);
24944  if (mKeyAxis.data()->orientation() == Qt::Horizontal)
24945  isVisible = ((!mKeyAxis.data()->rangeReversed() && barRect.right() >= lowerPixelBound) || (mKeyAxis.data()->rangeReversed() && barRect.left() <= lowerPixelBound));
24946  else // keyaxis is vertical
24947  isVisible = ((!mKeyAxis.data()->rangeReversed() && barRect.top() <= lowerPixelBound) || (mKeyAxis.data()->rangeReversed() && barRect.bottom() >= lowerPixelBound));
24948  if (isVisible)
24949  begin = it;
24950  else
24951  break;
24952  }
24953  // walk right from ubound to find upper bar that actually is completely outside visible pixel range:
24954  it = end;
24955  while (it != mDataContainer->constEnd())
24956  {
24957  const QRectF barRect = getBarRect(it->key, it->value);
24958  if (mKeyAxis.data()->orientation() == Qt::Horizontal)
24959  isVisible = ((!mKeyAxis.data()->rangeReversed() && barRect.left() <= upperPixelBound) || (mKeyAxis.data()->rangeReversed() && barRect.right() >= upperPixelBound));
24960  else // keyaxis is vertical
24961  isVisible = ((!mKeyAxis.data()->rangeReversed() && barRect.bottom() >= upperPixelBound) || (mKeyAxis.data()->rangeReversed() && barRect.top() <= upperPixelBound));
24962  if (isVisible)
24963  end = it+1;
24964  else
24965  break;
24966  ++it;
24967  }
24968 }
24969 
24976 QRectF QCPBars::getBarRect(double key, double value) const
24977 {
24978  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
24979  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
24980  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return {}; }
24981 
24982  double lowerPixelWidth, upperPixelWidth;
24983  getPixelWidth(key, lowerPixelWidth, upperPixelWidth);
24984  double base = getStackedBaseValue(key, value >= 0);
24985  double basePixel = valueAxis->coordToPixel(base);
24986  double valuePixel = valueAxis->coordToPixel(base+value);
24987  double keyPixel = keyAxis->coordToPixel(key);
24988  if (mBarsGroup)
24989  keyPixel += mBarsGroup->keyPixelOffset(this, key);
24990  double bottomOffset = (mBarBelow && mPen != Qt::NoPen ? 1 : 0)*(mPen.isCosmetic() ? 1 : mPen.widthF());
24991  bottomOffset += mBarBelow ? mStackingGap : 0;
24992  bottomOffset *= (value<0 ? -1 : 1)*valueAxis->pixelOrientation();
24993  if (qAbs(valuePixel-basePixel) <= qAbs(bottomOffset))
24994  bottomOffset = valuePixel-basePixel;
24995  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Horizontal)
24996  {
24997  return QRectF(QPointF(keyPixel+lowerPixelWidth, valuePixel), QPointF(keyPixel+upperPixelWidth, basePixel+bottomOffset)).normalized();
24998  } else
24999  {
25000  return QRectF(QPointF(basePixel+bottomOffset, keyPixel+lowerPixelWidth), QPointF(valuePixel, keyPixel+upperPixelWidth)).normalized();
25001  }
25002 }
25003 
25013 void QCPBars::getPixelWidth(double key, double &lower, double &upper) const
25014 {
25015  lower = 0;
25016  upper = 0;
25017  switch (mWidthType)
25018  {
25019  case wtAbsolute:
25020  {
25021  upper = mWidth*0.5*mKeyAxis.data()->pixelOrientation();
25022  lower = -upper;
25023  break;
25024  }
25025  case wtAxisRectRatio:
25026  {
25027  if (mKeyAxis && mKeyAxis.data()->axisRect())
25028  {
25029  if (mKeyAxis.data()->orientation() == Qt::Horizontal)
25030  upper = mKeyAxis.data()->axisRect()->width()*mWidth*0.5*mKeyAxis.data()->pixelOrientation();
25031  else
25032  upper = mKeyAxis.data()->axisRect()->height()*mWidth*0.5*mKeyAxis.data()->pixelOrientation();
25033  lower = -upper;
25034  } else
25035  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "No key axis or axis rect defined";
25036  break;
25037  }
25038  case wtPlotCoords:
25039  {
25040  if (mKeyAxis)
25041  {
25042  double keyPixel = mKeyAxis.data()->coordToPixel(key);
25043  upper = mKeyAxis.data()->coordToPixel(key+mWidth*0.5)-keyPixel;
25044  lower = mKeyAxis.data()->coordToPixel(key-mWidth*0.5)-keyPixel;
25045  // no need to qSwap(lower, higher) when range reversed, because higher/lower are gained by
25046  // coordinate transform which includes range direction
25047  } else
25048  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "No key axis defined";
25049  break;
25050  }
25051  }
25052 }
25053 
25063 double QCPBars::getStackedBaseValue(double key, bool positive) const
25064 {
25065  if (mBarBelow)
25066  {
25067  double max = 0; // don't initialize with mBaseValue here because only base value of bottom-most bar has meaning in a bar stack
25068  // find bars of mBarBelow that are approximately at key and find largest one:
25069  double epsilon = qAbs(key)*(sizeof(key)==4 ? 1e-6 : 1e-14); // should be safe even when changed to use float at some point
25070  if (key == 0)
25071  epsilon = (sizeof(key)==4 ? 1e-6 : 1e-14);
25072  QCPBarsDataContainer::const_iterator it = mBarBelow.data()->mDataContainer->findBegin(key-epsilon);
25073  QCPBarsDataContainer::const_iterator itEnd = mBarBelow.data()->mDataContainer->findEnd(key+epsilon);
25074  while (it != itEnd)
25075  {
25076  if (it->key > key-epsilon && it->key < key+epsilon)
25077  {
25078  if ((positive && it->value > max) ||
25079  (!positive && it->value < max))
25080  max = it->value;
25081  }
25082  ++it;
25083  }
25084  // recurse down the bar-stack to find the total height:
25085  return max + mBarBelow.data()->getStackedBaseValue(key, positive);
25086  } else
25087  return mBaseValue;
25088 }
25089 
25098 void QCPBars::connectBars(QCPBars *lower, QCPBars *upper)
25099 {
25100  if (!lower && !upper) return;
25101 
25102  if (!lower) // disconnect upper at bottom
25103  {
25104  // disconnect old bar below upper:
25105  if (upper->mBarBelow && upper->mBarBelow.data()->mBarAbove.data() == upper)
25106  upper->mBarBelow.data()->mBarAbove = nullptr;
25107  upper->mBarBelow = nullptr;
25108  } else if (!upper) // disconnect lower at top
25109  {
25110  // disconnect old bar above lower:
25111  if (lower->mBarAbove && lower->mBarAbove.data()->mBarBelow.data() == lower)
25112  lower->mBarAbove.data()->mBarBelow = nullptr;
25113  lower->mBarAbove = nullptr;
25114  } else // connect lower and upper
25115  {
25116  // disconnect old bar above lower:
25117  if (lower->mBarAbove && lower->mBarAbove.data()->mBarBelow.data() == lower)
25118  lower->mBarAbove.data()->mBarBelow = nullptr;
25119  // disconnect old bar below upper:
25120  if (upper->mBarBelow && upper->mBarBelow.data()->mBarAbove.data() == upper)
25121  upper->mBarBelow.data()->mBarAbove = nullptr;
25122  lower->mBarAbove = upper;
25123  upper->mBarBelow = lower;
25124  }
25125 }
25126 /* end of 'src/plottables/plottable-bars.cpp' */
25127 
25128 
25129 /* including file 'src/plottables/plottable-statisticalbox.cpp' */
25130 /* modified 2022-11-06T12:45:57, size 28951 */
25131 
25135 
25171 /* start documentation of inline functions */
25172 
25223 /* end documentation of inline functions */
25224 
25228 QCPStatisticalBoxData::QCPStatisticalBoxData() :
25229  key(0),
25230  minimum(0),
25231  lowerQuartile(0),
25232  median(0),
25233  upperQuartile(0),
25234  maximum(0)
25235 {
25236 }
25237 
25242 QCPStatisticalBoxData::QCPStatisticalBoxData(double key, double minimum, double lowerQuartile, double median, double upperQuartile, double maximum, const QVector<double> &outliers) :
25243  key(key),
25244  minimum(minimum),
25245  lowerQuartile(lowerQuartile),
25246  median(median),
25247  upperQuartile(upperQuartile),
25248  maximum(maximum),
25249  outliers(outliers)
25250 {
25251 }
25252 
25253 
25257 
25306 /* start documentation of inline functions */

25316 
25327 QCPStatisticalBox::QCPStatisticalBox(QCPAxis *keyAxis, QCPAxis *valueAxis) :
25328  QCPAbstractPlottable1D<QCPStatisticalBoxData>(keyAxis, valueAxis),
25329  mWidth(0.5),
25330  mWhiskerWidth(0.2),
25331  mWhiskerPen(Qt::black, 0, Qt::DashLine, Qt::FlatCap),
25332  mWhiskerBarPen(Qt::black),
25333  mWhiskerAntialiased(false),
25334  mMedianPen(Qt::black, 3, Qt::SolidLine, Qt::FlatCap),
25335  mOutlierStyle(QCPScatterStyle::ssCircle, Qt::blue, 6)
25336 {
25337  setPen(QPen(Qt::black));
25338  setBrush(Qt::NoBrush);
25339 }
25340 
25357 void QCPStatisticalBox::setData(QSharedPointer<QCPStatisticalBoxDataContainer> data)
25358 {
25359  mDataContainer = data;
25360 }
25372 void QCPStatisticalBox::setData(const QVector<double> &keys, const QVector<double> &minimum, const QVector<double> &lowerQuartile, const QVector<double> &median, const QVector<double> &upperQuartile, const QVector<double> &maximum, bool alreadySorted)
25373 {
25374  mDataContainer->clear();
25375  addData(keys, minimum, lowerQuartile, median, upperQuartile, maximum, alreadySorted);
25376 }
